quote: It is these sigils that identify us as a member of the squad.
My superior has sent you a few tricks which may prove useful. [...]. High magic: the ability to summon the entire 10th squad to a single location.
[Player: I could make the toys!] I don't think so, I reckon that would take you somewhere between 72 and 74 years even with the new make-all interface.
The Shield of Arrav by A R Wright.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: Well, below the very ground you stand upon lies an intricate network on tunnels that make up the abandoned Mort Ridge mines.
name: Mort Ridge

quote: Rank: Venator (Formerly)
Status: Deceased
It is a hard place to describe. We often refer to it as another plane, but that isn't quite accurate. If anything, it is more like a plane that sits between all other planes.
It [the Abyss] can be used as an effective hub for teleportation. In fact, all teleportation that we know of uses the Abyss, you just don't realise it.
Whenever you use a teleport spell, that spell is actually travelling through the Abyss and using it to link two places together.

You see, time and space work differently in the Abyss. For example, you can travel to the Abyss, walk a few steps and then exit, only to find yourself somewhere completely different from where you entered. You might even find yourself on a different plane. You can also enter the Abyss and spend days there, but on your return, only moments have passed.
We broke through to the Abyss, seeking allies for our cause, but instead I ended up a prisoner in this place, unable to leave, while the God Wars continued without me.
Bringing me those body parts from the Sires has now granted me enough teleportation energy to leave this living hell hole.

By remaining here and holding this rift open, I am providing a permanent link between normal space and this strange dimension. As long as my spell remains in effect, we have the capability to teleport into the Abyss.

North of this town the atmosphere becomes bitterly cold. There are a number of small inhabited islands that we have sea routes with... ...Beyond those islands, there is a large frozen wasteland we call Acheron.
It is an inhospitable land, and you will need an agile and sturdy body just to keep alive in it's perils.
Up by Acheron it gets so cold that when you talk you see the words freeze in the air in front of you!
I have a story to tell you that will answer most of your questions. Let us travel back in time, to the time you humans call the Fourth Age.
notes: Cutscene shows King Healthorg mounted on Mibbiwocket, who was a gift from Admiral Bake.

quote: The oldest tortoise ever recorded was Mibbiwocket, who was presented to the King Healthorg the Great, by the famous explorer Admiral Bake, shortly after its birth.
name: Tortoise

quote: Name the explorer who discovered the world's oldest tortoise.
It is written that Xeric killed the rulers of Kourend's five cities and claimed the kingdom as his own.
Xeric ruled Kourend for more than ten dark decades using an army of lizardmen. This time period was known as the Age of Strife.
The Dark Altar was the key to Xeric's power. Because of it, he was able to rule Kourend unopposed for nearly a hundred years.
Lizardmen are loyal creatures and would do as he commanded without question. With them at his disposal, the people were powerless to resist his authority.
The King himself died a few years later and was succeeded by Xeric, a tyrannical mage who made the King seem meek in comparison.
Xeric used the citizens of Kourend for many experiments, as well as for his own sadistic pleasures.
It is written that Xeric killed the rulers of Kourend's five cities and claimed the kingdom as his own.
Xeric ruled Kourend for more than ten dark decades using an army of lizardmen.
name: ref3

quote: Originally, we believed that Xeric created the lizardmen. However, recent discovieres [sic]Â suggest they were actually created during the time of King Shayzien VII.
However, we assume Xeric genetically altered [the lizardmen] to enforce that their duty is to serve him.
name: ref2

quote: The experimentation is proving successful and we will soon be ready to mass produce.
The King himself died a few years later and was succeeded by Xeric, a tyrannical mage who made the King seem meek in comparison.
His reign was so dark, it became known as the Age of Strife.
The Dark Altar was the key to Xeric's power. Because of it, he was able to rule Kourend unopposed for nearly a hundred years.
Xeric was undoubtedly powerful, but he couldn't rule the people singlehandedly, nor could he rely on human informants. He needed an army he could control.
Sadly so, though we're not exactly sure how he did so. Xeric used the citizens of Kourend for many experiments, as well as for his own sadistic pleasures.
When he ruled Kourend, we know Xeric performed experiments on the living, using power drawn from the Dark Altar.
Originally, we believed that Xeric created the lizardmen. However, recent discovieres [sic] suggest they were actually created during the time of King Shayzien VII.
Xeric used the citizens of Kourend for many experiments, as well as for his own sadistic pleasures.

Unfortunately, we don't possess full understanding of the Tower of Magic and its many enchantments, so we often discover remnants of traps. (...) I have dedicated my life to studying the powerful enchantments that conceal the many levels of the Tower, though it proves difficult at times.

Agrith Naar is not so much a demon as a force of nature. While he is in his own dimension his evil magics can reach everywhere in the world. No one knows how far his power extends, but Reen and I believe that much of the suffering in the world is due to him. The accident that cripples a man, the storm that sweeps a ship under the sea, the sudden fire in the blood that makes a wolf pack attack a town - all that is Agrith Naar!
Agrith-Naar was one of the demons my master banished at the end of the great war.

It is from an ancient language. The direct translation is... 'Magnificence floating on water'. (...) Even the great priest Zadimus who built the temple did not survive. Some say that Rashiliyia caused the temple to collapse.
Our two kingdoms were at war with one another for centuries. They tried to expand their kingdom northwards many times over the years, but we held them off.
The desert is a great equalizer. It's very difficult to move large armies about in it, particularly if you don't have ready access to water.
Technically, yes, but that doesn't mean that bad blood will instantly run good.
You could bring me the head of Al Zaba Bhasim. He is the leader of the notorius desert bandits, they plague us daily.
name: leader

quote: [...] he could be anywhere. He's a nomadic desert dweller. However, they say that he's frequently to be found to the west in the hospitality of the Tentis.
notes: The Tentis refers to the inhabitants of Bedabin Camp, dubbed so because they live in tents.

quote: [...] by all accounts, he is a slippery fellow. The Captain has been trying to capture him for years.
Huh! You have been talking to the guards at the mining camp. Or worse, that cowardly mercenary captain. Al Zaba Bhasim does not exist, he is a figment of their imagination!
The Alfred Grimhand Barcrawl! First completed by Alfred Grimhand.
Originally it [the barcrawl] was a funny prank back in the day for new recruits.
Me bruva, Alfredo, does. E runs the Fettuccine Mafia.
name: Brother

quote: AMCE Lift-In-A-Box, Pulley-Beams-In-A-Box, Beams-In-A-Box and Ropes-In-A-Box are all registered trademarks of Ali Morrisane Commercial Enterprises (AMCE) Ltd.
name: Lift

quote: The Little Book o' Piracy... By Cap'n Hook-Hand Morrisane... (an AMCE product)
name: Piracy

quote: [I hear you work for Ali Morrisane...] Yes, he bought these tents and had them put up for us. He says he'll also get our goods in so we can start selling them soon.
[I hear you work for Ali Morrisane...] Of course, he's the one who's going to obtain cloth and clothes patterns so I can set up shop here.
[I hear you work for Ali Morrisane...] Yes, he's the one who persuaded us to come here.
[I hear you work for Ali Morrisane...] Yeah, he hired me. He owns this house and these two tents, too.
Sometimes I travel to market fairs in distant lands, and I use my feminine arts to lure young farmers back to this land; then the vampyres come for them and I see them no more.
All I know is, years ago, that temple started glowing green and, a few months later, I woke up dead.
It's that fountain thingy in the temple to the east. It's turned them all into zombies.
I tried that once, but all those other ghosts - and even the undead chickens and cows - scared me so much, I wouldn't try it again for all the cash in Varrock bank.
Great! I'm laying away me tokens for some killer cows. That'll learn them bone rustlers.
They stole a suit of armour when they first broke in months ago, but they've been back four more times since then and taken nothing.
Up to now, our attempts to recover this scroll have been met with disappointment.
While the gods are useful for tedious matters such as granting prayers during combat, we of Arceuus have long moved beyond the need to pay them homage.
Saradomin is popular with many uneducated citizens of Kourend, but you may use our church to worship any god you prefer. That would be an ecumenical matter.
[Player: The Devourer?] She's the very incarnation of destruction.
During the great war, our forces were decimated by the servants of the Ruinous Powers.

To turn the tide, Icthlarin and Amascut sought powerful allies to aid us. They found them far from here, in a place beyond this world. A powerful race of faceless ones. They became Icthlarin's Stern Judges.
The armies of the Ruinous Powers were far stronger than our own. That was until Icthlarin's Stern Judges joined the fray. Thanks to them, the war was seemingly won.
Among the Stern Judges, there was a serpent. After my father [Osmumten] became Pharaoh, this serpent convinced the others to abandon us.

The last of her priestesses gathered and cursed her.[...]Our curse trapped her in a human form, limiting her power. We also cursed her to never be willing worshipped again, though I fear that curse has started to wane.

Unfortunately, she also cast a spell of her own, condemning us to an eternity of walking Gielinor in her form.[...]There are fewer of us priestesses left now, but we still hold enough power to be quite the problem for her.

Cats play a significant role in the religion of this area, particularly when it comes to guarding the dead from the Devourer.[...]The Devourer is terrified of cats for reasons I will not explain. However, her followers, although few in number, are not. I ensure the survival of cats. For this service, Icthlarin grants me eternal life.
When the war was over, my father was tasked with hiding those weapons, lest they fall into nefarious hands. Two of them were buried with him.
The weapons in my father's tomb can be used to drain a being of divine energy and transfer that energy to another. If used correctly, they would grant the Devourer true godhood.
The four of them [Apmeken, Crondis, Het, and Scabaras] all came from Tumeken himself. Their power is his power. If she claims that power as her own, she will become a true goddess...
We helped her capture them. It took many lifetimes, but she was able to fool them all.
We've been able to open the way for you! I wish we could help you down there, but we're still too weak.
We have opened the way for you, my friend. Any other day, I would have joined you in the fight against Amascut, but this one is up to you. Go now, and show her the error of her ways!
My plan has only just begun! Even with this setback, those pathetic fragments of my father have still given me ample power. My strength is absolute!
The Theory of Transvergence, by Amon Ducot.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: Transportation Incantations, by Amon Ducot.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: startling differences between the creation of runes both here and in other lands.
It is almost as if the Dark Altar has some sense of self preservation and is looking for as many ways as possible to be integral to our community and thus, gain power within it.
Ah, but that reminds me, I was not the first in my family to join the order. This amulet was passed down from generation to generation.

[Player: It's called the Temple of the Eye. It was built by Saradominist wizards long ago to house a powerful artefact. (...) You've heard of it?] Only stories, of which there are very few. Still, I always believed them to be real. After all, why else would an eye be the symbol of the Order of Wizards?
We [aviantese] were here to claim something. To protect it. But everything else is unclear.
Big High War God use the shiny to kill the chickens! Now we clear up the rest!
Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but I think this 'shiny' might have killed you as well.

[Player: Hang on... you're properly talking to me, without using a mind meld. I thought you only spoke ancient gnomish?] Bah! I've always been able to speak your uncivilised tongue. Normally I wouldn't lower myself to these rudimentary words, but given your recent near-death experience, I felt you would not have the energy for a mind meld.
[Sliske]: The dwarves of Acheron uncovered it. They lost their home as a result. They fled south, but some remained under its control. They brought it with them.
Mysterious Voice 1: What am I looking at here? [Sliske]: An answer. Mysterious Voice 1: To what question? [Sliske]: What lies beyond?

Mysterious Voice 1: Then we'd better not waste time. There are resources that can be diverted, though there will be pushback. [Sliske]: It will be dealt with. My companion will remain to oversee your research. She will ensure that you face no barriers.
Mysterious Voice 2: What did they speak of? Mysterious Voice 1: Seas, curses and something called blackstone. It didn't really make much sense.
[Sliske]: I have shielded it. It will do you no harm.
The totem seems to act as a conduit between our world and the Shadow Realm.
[Sliske]: Have the undercity sealed, then remove the protections on the totem. We require a more thorough test.

Mysterious Voice 2: The undercity is being sealed. They say the fortress has fallen. Mysterious Voice 3: Sealed? On whose orders? Mysterious Voice 2: Well... yours. Mysterious Voice 3: I gave no such order. Round up the centurions! We have a traitor among us. [The Whisperer]: No. Mysterious Voice 3: You! This was your doing! [The Whisperer]: You have served your Empire well, High Magister, but that servitude is at an end. Now it is time for a new one to begin.
Mysterious Voice 1: Do not be afraid, my child, for you are not alone. Your voice will be one of thousands, singing an eternal silence.[...]And so another voice joins the Silent Choir.
Its influence has been weakened. Without the totem, it cannot spread beyond this city.

I managed to find the remnants of the ancient civilisation that the stories talked about. It seems people used to worship a god there years ago in numbers far greater than a simple cult following. Sadly there is little remaining so I have nothing else to tell. As soon as I entered this area the ground swallowed me whole. I felt there was something watching, waiting. It's like there is some evil power under the ground that wanted me to suffer. As if it got some sort of empowerment from it. At least what ever it is, it doesn't want to reveal itself to the world yet...
[...] the Anima Mundi, the life force of our world.
[...] I felt a sudden pain, as if the Anima Mundi was crying out with the loss of a favoured child.... And I knew that one of the Old Ones had died, and I had lost a friend.
name: spirit tree

quote: Here, you can grow Iasor, Kronos and Attas plants. [...] Three unique plants with a special affinity to the Anima Mundi, the life force of our world.
I wish to witness the moment when the individual cabbage's connection to the Anima Mundi is irreversibly severed, as you pluck it from the nurturing soil in the field south of Falador.
name: cabbage

quote: When planted, all three of these plants have a unique impact on the Anima Mundi.
The anima of this world, it is fed by life.
name: life

quote:
* Kaal-Mej-San: Without life, there is no anima.
* Kaal-Ket-Jor: But life can also destroy. It can endanger the anima.
* Kaal-Xil-Dar: So life must be kept in check.
* Kaal-Mej-San: This is our purpose.
Some forces in this world move in mysterious ways. Gravity, the Anima Mundi and the price of granite mauls are just three everyday examples.
That's alright. My name is Louisiana Jones, although most people call me Anna. I'm an archaeologist.
Hah! No, I used to, but now I prefer to work freelance for independent employers.
I can say that I can't say anything about what you want me to say!

I'm investigating the relative co-existence of convergent entries from two para-dimensional spaces into a quantum metaphysical universe and exponential decay of said pathways in the event of fluctuations in the space-time cortex.
Annakarl fell early in the war to forces of Saradomin. Attempts to reclaim the fortress have so far been unsuccessful.
Last Known Location [of Zilyana]: Annakarl
Last Known Location [of Lamistard]: Annakarl
Status: Deceased
Last Known Location: Carrallanger
His lord had a beautiful daughter, Arastasia, with whom he was in love
That winter was the Great Winter which drew down the Wintertodt from the north, It proceeded to devour the animals upon the farm and freezing the next year's crops.
The lord had no food and Arastasia wept at the fear and distress caused to her people.

I vow that I will venture into the mountains and destroy the beast so it shall trouble us no more....

...if you succeed I will grant you my daughter's hand in marriage as you will truly be the only man that can make her happy.
Dentristus lay dead before he even saw the Wintertodt
The Grand Library of Great Kourend has verified and collated the following extracts from various historical texts
There are many souls that find themselves trapped here after death. My people and I do our best to release them.
It was under [the Council] that trade with your lands to the east was established. Without those trade routes, you would have no easy way of getting here.

...we did manage to search his [Xamphur's] lair in Molch. Most of it had been cleared out before we arrived. There was some research left behind though. Notes on potential new spells. Some are far too dangerous to use, but others we've found to be safe. We're preparing a tome of all the ones that are suitable.

A battle ensued that ended with the two ex-friends at the top of the outpost as the sole survivors. Realising their mistakes they made friends again. One decided to become King and spread the word of equality [...] The one that became king is the great grandfather of the King Lathas that we know!
I made the deal with Lord Iorwerth. In return for access to West Ardougne, he agreed to help me kill my brother and drive out King Arthur.
Those that you know as mourners are in fact elves in service to Lord Iorwerth. We regularly see them crossing the Arandar mountain pass and into the east.
They were searching for some sort of temple. According to Lord Iorwerth, the power there would be essential in summoning ... the Dark Lord.
That should stop anyone from entering for another thousand years.
It seems some dwarves have broken in through the back of the temple.
It all started when you told me the truth about the king. I realised that it would take more than just us two to overthrow him, so I started to find allies for us.
Wear your Knight of Ardougne disguise and use it to turn people against the king in East Ardougne.
You'll want to build support in West Ardougne as well but the knights aren't allowed here. You can use your mourner disguise instead though.
Lathas Ardignas, as decided by the people of Ardougne, you are hereby sentenced to death!
Arengeesus, God of luck. We do not know much about her or where she comes from, we just know she is there looking over us.
Those who praise Arengeesus enough to get her attention are rewarded. She will gaze down upon you providing you with luck on your adventures.
I was one of the elves born in Baxtorian's new kingdom.
After Baxtorian left to try and retake Prifddinas, my parents were among those who joined him. They never returned. I was still just a child at the time, alone and afraid.
Oh, thank Armadyl! I am in such a worry... please help me!
Lieutenant Shepbur, commanding officer of the new Armoured Tortoise Regiment.
This is just the beginning! Gnome breeders and trainers are already working to expand the number of units. Soon we'll have hundreds of these beauties, nay thousands!
And they will not only carry mages and archers but other fiendish weapons of destruction of gnome devising.
Next is a battle axe, its card reads: 'The Axe of Arrav, left behind by accident before he journeyed on his quest for the shield to save the people of Avarrocka'.
When I faced Zemouregal, I cast the shield to the son of Avarrocka's founder. Only then did the zombies meet their doom.

For over 150 years it was the prize piece in the royal museum of Varrock. However, in the year 143 of the fifth age a gang of thieves called the Phoenix Gang broke into the museum and stole the shield in a daring raid. As a result, the current ruler, King Roald, put a 1200 gold bounty (a massive sum of money in those days) on the return of the shield, hoping that one of the culprits would betray his fellows out of greed. This tactic did not work...

About five years ago we had a massive fight in our gang and the shield got broken in half during that fight. Shortly after the fight some gang members decided they didn't want to be part of our gang anymore. So they split off to form their own gang. The Black Arm Gang. On their way out they looted what treasures they could from us - which included one of the halves of the shield. We've been rivals with the Black Arms ever since.

Following your request, I have spend some time re-reading the relevant scrolls in the Library of Varrock. It appears that when your forefathers encountered that adventurer, he was on a quest to find a mysterious shield.
Well, it all started the day I was fishing in Catherby, funnily enough.

Well, it might not seem much to us now kid, but back then, it was a revelation! Why waste my time fishing when there were secret treasures from long ago hidden around the world? I immediately applied to the Museum of Varrock as a field agent, and the rest is history!

Well anyway, let's just assume there's a treasure hidden in the desert somewhere, and let's just say for the sake of argument that maybe if I found a big stash of gold and treasure I wouldn't necessarily hand it all over to the Museum of Varrock.
name: Dishonesty

quote: Ah, don't sweat it kid. I'll be honest with ya - I'm already rich many times over, and its more the kicks of being a treasure hunter I do it for than the actual cash!
You spoke to the legendary Asgarnia Smith??? Quickly, let me see what he had to give you! He is always at the forefront of archaeological breakthroughs!
Hey, thanks kid. Looking snazzy is an important part of being a treasure hunter!
I'm the leading archaeological expert of our time! I was voted archaeologist of the year four years running by the Varrock Herald! Are you REALLY sure you've never heard of me?
I am the one who discovered the long forgotten Temple of Ikov! The one who unearthed the strange trap filled arena in Brimhaven!
Well, while he was screaming and waving his sword around, I stood behind a nearby stalactite, then shot him with my shortbow. And that was how I recovered the Golden Monkey of Tee-Ta-Toh.
Well, that's where you'd be wrong. I work for the Archaeological Society of Varrock, and have been excavating around here recently.
Aw... I was hoping to go abroad on holiday this year. Maybe I'll go check out Karamja next, I hear there's treasure to be found there...
Later in the war, a great battle broke out in the Temple of Lost Ancients. I was a Saradominist soldier at the time, and I was among those who fought for him in that battle.
...many of us had grown tired of war. One of our priests discovered this. He came to us and revealed that he felt the same way, and that he had secretly converted to Guthix.
He encouraged us to join him. We abandoned the cause of Saradomin and became followers of Guthix.
Our new leader taught us the ways of the druids, including an ancient ritual that had the power to awaken Guthix himself. We believed this ritual to be the only way to end the war.
When our leader led us to perform the ritual, it was not Guthix we woke, but Nex and her forces. The ritual also destroyed the protective enchantments on their prison.
I never saw him [the priest] again. He never gave us his true name, but as Nex was freed, she spoke to him... I heard little of what they said, but I did hear what she called him. Sliske.
Nex posed such a danger, that the four armies temorarily joined forces to drive her back into the prison. They resealed it, but were unable to fix the enchantments we destroyed.
I was one of the first to fall after Nex was freed, but I didn't truly die. Something about our ritual tied me to this place. I've been trapped here ever since. Not dead, but not really alive either.
I fear you have been misled. There is no treasure here, only our great mistake.
If it helps, while my magic is limited here, I should still be able to transfer items in and out of the prison for you. Let me know if you'd like me to do this before you enter.

What would [Saradomin] have me do?
[Zachariah: You must build a sanctuary for the Eye. The forces of chaos already seek to reobtain it, as do countless others.] I will keep it safe, no matter the cost.
notes: There is some ambiguity still as to how much Atlax actually knew about the temple, as the first entry in their diary does mention previously having heard "stories of how grand it was", despite apparently not knowing its true purpose.

quote: The Justiciar of the Lion is a title bestowed upon the most powerful wizard of our order. She was capable of wiping out an entire army of Zamorakian demons with a single spell!
Last I heard, she was residing in the college here in Hallowvale.
It seems we're deep below the sea, just south of Morytania!

The Eye was removed after the battle, but not before the Justiciar of the Lion used it to seal the rift once more. She then created us, the Guardians of the Rift, to protect this place in the event the rift was ever reopened.
Then, with the power from this 'Eye' and support from their rune guardians, they'd have been able to create runes at lightning speed!
That rift they have is a folded-space storage rift, just like the ones Traiborn uses! Small on the outside, but big on the inside!
The aviantese are alive, and I suspect they still guard the Godsword!
We're doing a bit. Having Nardah and Pollnivneach nearby helps and we're also getting a lot of trade from adventurers these days.
Rank: Pontifex Maximus

The spiteful Saradomin and pathetic Zamorak warred with each other, but the hatred they had for each other was as nothing to the hatred they held towards us! With each battle they waged, we lost more and more land, unable to fight on all fronts, and were pushed further and further South into this gods-forsaken desert. Our greatest hero, Azzanadra, was finally trapped in a strange stone structure to the South of here, and bound within by terrible powers...
Mahjarrat such as Lucien and Azzanadra would become very powerful if they came into possession of the Staff of Armadyl
We were forced into fighting for the god Bandos, or as I like to call him, the Big High Idiot.
The Alfred Grimhand Barcrawl! First completed by Alfred Grimhand.
Originally it [the barcrawl] was a funny prank back in the day for new recruits.

It was then [after the Betrayal of Zaros] that the other gods appeared and banished Zamorak from the world completely for daring to kill one of their kind, although as it turned out it didn't quite work out that way for them, when he returned stronger than ever, a god himself.
...he [Saradomin] has given us the task of protecting it [the Eye].
You must build a sanctuary for the Eye. The forces of chaos already seek to reobtain it, as do countless others.
Aliya. You must keep the Eye secret from all others, even our own. The fewer people that know the truth, the better.
The Eye was removed after the battle, but not before the Justiciar of the Lion used it to seal the rift once more.
She then created us, the Guardians of the Rift, to protect this place in the event the rift was ever reopened.

The Carnillean home does not belong to them. The builder of the house was Lord Hazeel, one of the Mahjarrat followers of Zamorak. Many years ago there was a civil war in this land, and the hateful Saradominists declared war upon all Zamorakians who lived here.
I found a secret cult in Ardougne and found that the Carnillean family started building the city of Ardougne from a house they'd captured from a Zamorakian lord.
notes: The player says this while talking to Historian Minas after the completion of Hazeel Cult.

quote: The elves mysteriously decided to travel west, leaving most of Kandarin open for conquest.
Both armies moved to claim the lands, and were of course destined to meet in battle. And so it came to pass the Goblin and Gnome armies met at the Battle of Atarisundri.
our gnomes were brave, but we were no match for the mass of brute goblin stupidity.
Glouphrie and King Healthorg had devised a plan.
All I've managed to establish was that he was particularly interested in optics and light magic.
Glouphrie created an army of illusory Giant tortoises, knowing that goblins would be scared of anything bigger than they were.

Many of them are alive only because of the actions of me and my steed Hekala. At the battle of Carrallanger [sic] I rescued Corveth from the flames that threatened to consume her. I dove my dragon deep into the flames, though the heat would mark my flesh forever, and I grasped her hand before the tower collapsed beneath her. If it were not for me she would have perished there and then. Just another statistic in another battle.
name: Ablenkian

quote: But General Bloodfist of the Dorgeshuun refused to fight in this battle. Instead he commanded the Dorgeshuun army to march down into a fissure in the ground. General Bloodfist stood at the mouth of the fissure and defied the might of the evil god.
We've been cut off from other goblins for generations
It rain many days. But rain not stop goblins. Goblin feet churn up ground with rain and goblin blood. All ground turn to mud. That why it called Battle of Plain of Mud.

With that information I can say with confidence that these are the ruins of Uzer, an advanced human civilization said to have been destroyed towards the end of the Third Age (roughly 2,500 years ago).
name: VarmenNotes

quote: A great demon. It broke through from its dimension to attack the city.
Many were destroyed, but we drove the demon back!
The king spent a lot of his time at the Tower [of Magic], more than any other king. In fact, he oversaw the construction of various new sections, most notably the prison.
There are some who believe that King Shayzien VII and Xeric were one and the same. They claim that after his death, the King was resurrected by his followers, taking on the name Xeric.
Rickard! Turn away! Don't do this!
notes: Upon inspecting the Unstable Altar at the end of Tale of the Righteous, a structure most likely built by Shayzien VII in order to amplify the powers of the Dark Altar, the player hears a voice crying out 'Rickard!'

quote: King Hosidius V ruled Kourend until the early days of the 33rd decade. It was then that King Shayzien VII took control of the kingdom. His rule was a notably violent one.
King Shayzien VII was one of Kourend's most notable rulers. According to the history books, his reign was defined by violence.

list: quote:From the evidence we have, I believe that King Shayzien VII ordered an expedition to Quidamortem, hoping to discover a suitable species for his lizardman project. Once the expedition found one, he had them killed to keep the discovery a secret.
notes: A record of the members recruited for the expedition can be found in The Great Expedition.

quote: Most of the journal is illegible but I've still managed to find a few readable extracts. Listen to this one... 'Quidamortem's creatures are compatible. The experimentation is proving successful and we will soon be ready to mass produce.'
The King was killed at the Battle of the Concourse during the 37th decade. We have many accounts of this, yet his body was never recovered.
Just days after his death, we have the first recorded mention of Xeric, an incredibly powerful mage who resembled the King.
There are some who believe that King Shayzien VII and Xeric were one and the same. They claim that after his death, the King was resurrected by his followers, taking on the name Xeric.
During the time of King Shayzien VII, the Tower of Magic was the seat of power in Kourend. The king spent a lot of his time at the Tower, more than any other king.
During the Fourth Age, the vampyre forces of Lowerniel Drakan attempted to invade Misthalin. They would have succeeded, were it not for the Seven Priestly Warriors.
They led the armies of Misthalin against the vampyres in a great battle that took place right where this temple stands.

For ten days and nights they fought, never sleeping, never eating, fuelled by their desire to make the world a better place for humans to live. On the eleventh day they were to be joined by reinforcements. However, when those reinforcements arrived, they found the Seven Priestly Warriors and their forces had been slain by the vampyres.
Their sacrifice was not in vain though. Before they were defeated, the Seven Priestly Warriors managed to bless the Salve with the holy power of Saradomin.

In the midst of Mort Myre lies a long cavern running from north-west to south-east, with three caverns along the south-western wall and two caverns on the north-eastern. Ivandis was put to rest in the smaller of the two caverns along the north-eastern wall with his worldly possessions.
While we were gone, an uprising had occurred in the eastern kingdom. We took our best fighters to Prifddinas, those that remained were unable to hold back the enemy.
While [Baxtorian] was fighting Lord Iorwerth, invaders took control of our kingdom to the east.

I led my forces through the Underground Pass and confronted him at the city gates. [...] I tried to reason with him, but he had already decided that I was his enemy. (...) The Iorwerth forces had the strength and safety of the city walls though. They slowly whittled us down until we were too weak to carry on. We had no choice but to retreat.

We fell back into the Underground Pass, intending to return to our kingdom in the east. Lord Iorwerth sent his forces in after us, hoping to wipe us out. [...] We no longer had the strength in numbers, but we still outmatched the Iorwerth troops in skill and experience. We fought back while we retreated. Both sides suffered huge losses.
[Iorwerth] claimed Prifddinas as his own. Baxtorian tried to take it back from him, but Prifddinas was built to survive the God Wars. There was no way to retake it.
Baxtorian and the other clan elders made one final ditch attempt to save Prifddinas. They sung the song of inversion to revert the entire city to a crystal seed.
After Prifddinas was reverted to seed, the clan elders went into hiding. Before we parted ways, the others did leave me with some clues on how to find them.
My wife was taken and most of my people were slaughtered. I turned my attention to finding my wife and getting the rest of my people to safety. [...] Lord Iorwerth became the least of my problems.
Unable to find [Glarial], [Baxtorian] sealed himself beneath the waterfall where they lived, never to be seen again.
[The Varrock Herald] is edited, printed and published by myself, Benny Gutenberg.
I am unsure who had built [the temple], or why they had left it seemingly abandoned, but inside I located a great treasure... It was the godstaff of Armadyl.
I chose that day to take it so that my Lord Saradomin's power and prestige could be increased by its possession.
The vile thief Rennard accosted me as I made my way to Entrana, and after defeating me with a sneak attack, plundered the staff from my person, and left me for dead..
Anysways, I unwraps this staff, and sees it be a god- weapon; I may be just a common thief, but I recognises a weapon not made by mortal hands when I sees one.
Anyway, I hired me a messenger to go off and let [Zaros] know I had something I was prepared to sell that I thought he'd be interested in...
Ah yes, Lord Zamorak. He was merely a mortal back then, you know?
Well, that's the other funny thing... He never showed up, he sent some General or other instead.

But I digress. I let Lord Zamorak know that there was some drunken fool with an artefact of incredible power that could probably be bought off with a few jewels and trinkets, ... and he escorted me to the tavern and made the purchase there and then.
Let me see... I had been working as a spy for my Lord Saradomin, amongst the forces of... the Empty Lord.
If he had taken possession of this god-weapon, then his power would have been so great that he could have overthrown all on this world, and made it into his own image!
I went immediately to my comrade Dhalak, the mage, and told him that a message had come to the lair offering this weapon for sale!
I knew that as soon as my Lord Saradomin heard this, he would contact Armadyl to inform them of the theft, and the matter would have been resolved quickly and discreetly.

Indeed I did. To my eternal shame, I decided that I would assist Zamorak and his henchmen in their battle, by secretly casting a spell of concealment upon the staff so that ... they might use it secretly against their master.

Now, as powerful, long-lived and evil as they were, they were still just mortal, and I made the decision that it would be of benefit to my Lord Saradomin for his mightiest rival to be distracted by such internal conflicts
No, nobody except myself, and now you, knew that I cast such a spell....

So anyway, Lord Zamorak and his most trusted compatriots, namely myself, Hazeel, Drakan, Thammaron and Zemouregal made plans to overthrow our lord using the god-weapon, and by pledging allegiance to Zamorak as our master, were each to be given a large piece of land as our own in return.
While we distracted the Empty Lord with our feints and attacks, and kept his bodyguards busy, Lord Zamorak outflanked him, unsheathed the staff and plunged it into his back!
Even with the weapon of a god embedded in his back, he fought on, and with each blow our victory seemed less and less certain...

You can call it what you want, but as the Empty Lords hands wrapped tightly around Zamorak's throat, Lord Zamorak, kicking and screaming defiantly and radiant in his anger until the very last, plunged towards the Empty Lord, who seemed to lose his footing slightly, and fell in such a way so that the staff plunged deeper into his body, but also impaled Lord Zamorak with it at the same time...

Zamorak stood over the Empty Lord who was slowly... fading from existence... And as he faded, it seemed as though... It almost seemed as though Zamorak became more real, more solid than he had been before...

And as the Empty Lord faded from this world completely, I heard his voice, almost a whisper upon the wind, cursing all who had helped Zamorak in his victory, which as you now tell me seems to have been all who were responsible for the staff ending up in Zamorak's hands at the castle.

It was then that the other gods appeared and banished Zamorak from the world completely for daring to kill one of their kind, although as it turned out it didn't quite work out that way for them, when he returned stronger than ever, a god himself.
But the god wars were another story entirely...

Who knows why the curse fell as it did? Perhaps as a mere human I was more susceptible to it, when they were not. Perhaps they too are cursed, but their life spans are so long that it will be millennia before they feel it upon them.

Then came the betrayal. Our god was banished, leaving us helpless to our fates. [...] The spiteful Saradomin and pathetic Zamorak warred with each other, but the hatred they had for each other was as nothing to the hatred they held towards us! With each battle they waged, we lost more and more land, unable to fight on all fronts, and were pushed further and further South into this gods-forsaken desert. Our greatest hero, Azzanadra, was finally trapped in a strange stone structure to the South of here, and bound within by terrible powers... And with that our lands, our homes, our very lives were stolen from us! Too weak to reclaim what was rightfully ours, we made our homes here, knowing that someday Azzanadra will return with his magnificent power, and bring us back to our former glory...
A small, family business. We give financial advice to other companies.
Shortly after the fight some gang members decided they didn't want to be part of our gang anymore. So they split off to form their own gang. The Black Arm Gang.
the shield got broken in half during that fight.
On their way out they looted what treasures they could from us - which included one of the halves of the shield.
[Black Knight Captain: No need to... get upset... you're scaring the cat.] 'The CAT'? She's not 'THE CAT'! She's Maemi... aren't you dear....

In the face of inevitable death, a powerful shaman decided to lash out and inflict death on others. Her fellows disagreed with her actions. They created this prison, and they summoned me to watch over it.

Mother and I must pay a tithe of blood to the vampyres. Father would have protected us, but he is no longer with us, although his presence still walks among us in the fields. We pay with the blood of others.
The city is split into sectors so that the vampyres can collect blood tithes on a rotational basis.

In the face of inevitable death, a powerful shaman decided to lash out and inflict death on others. Her fellows disagreed with her actions. They created this prison, and they summoned me to watch over it.
Little book of embalming by Bod E. Wrapper.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: Embalming is an essential part of Menaphite funerary practice.
The Book of Light and Day says that Tumeken once fell into a deep sleep and dreamt for four days and four nights.

You'll have a job. I've been drinking this for a week. [Player: 'Captain Braindeath's Extra Strength Rum/Drain Cleaner. Now 50% more debilitating'?] It's the extra sheep tranquilizers that gives it that added kick!
I can't live with your rules any more. Mother. I'm tired of working hard for very little money. There's great wealth that's mine for the taking!
No. You see I haven't seen him for... for.... 25 years now.
Sorry, but your mother and I... tried so hard to find you!
name: Search

quote: My husband went to look, but he hasn't returned for days.
I was foolish to ignore my parents' warnings when I ran away that day. Luckily I've been able to patch things up with them so they've returned home with peace of mind.

[Player: Can't I just give you a cabbage of my own?] No, I wish to witness the moment when the individual cabbage's connection to the Anima Mundi is irreversibly severed, as you pluck it from the nurturing soil in the field south of Falador.
[Kaal-Mej-San: Without life, there is no anima.] [Kaal-Ket-Jor: But life can also destroy. It can endanger the anima.] So life must be kept in check.

What kingdom does he rule then? [Player: England...] Where on Gielinor is that? [Player: It's not! That's what I've been trying to tell you. I found that King Arthur and his knights are really biding their time here in Gielinor until they are called back to their own world, when they are needed!]
Hail Arthur, King of the Britons! [Player: Um... Hello.]
Careful Lathas. I have seen the horrors of war first hand. This is not something we should merrily jump into.
Well, we recently found out that the Holy Grail has passed into Gielinor. This is most fortuitous! None of my knights ever did return with it last time.

Unfortunately, our current quest is to rescue Merlin. Back in England, he got himself trapped in some sort of magical Crystal. We've moved him from the cave we found him in and now he's upstairs in his tower.
[Player: So what are you doing in Gielinor?] Well legend says we will return to Britain in its time of greatest need. But that's not for quite a while yet.

The Sinclairs have disappeared, though I'm not sorry to see them go, but what worries me is the disappearance of King Arthur and his knights around the same time. [Player: They haven't returned to their other realm have they?] No, there's no evidence to suggest that.
It has the image of a pegasus on it.

It used to be just humans trampling past my cave and making a racket. Now there's those blasted trolls too! Not only do they stink and argue with each other loudly but they are always fighting the humans.
We do not disclose his majesty's business.

The White Knights have overlooked us, until now! They are pouring money into their war against the Black Knights, so they are looking for an excuse to stop our funding and I'm afraid they may have found it! If we can not destroy the troll camp on Death Plateau then the Imperial Guard will be disbanded and Burthorpe will come under control of the White Knights.
name: Denulth

quote: The lizardmen, while strong and powerful, were simply outnumbered. In a matter of days, they had been driven back into the Kebos Lowlands.
name: feelthebyrne

quote: 'Twas the 312th day of decade 47.
Byrne, a farmer by trade, is said to have witnessed a lizardman guard murder a child whilst working his farm.
Outraged at what he had just seen, Byrne grabbed his pitchfork and sprinted towards the guard. Blinded by fury, Byrne attacked the guard, slaughtering the lizardman in plain sight of all around.

Legend has it Byrne then gave a galvanizing speech, standing over the butchered guard with his bloodied pitchfork held aloft in the air, urging the people to fight back.(...) Whatever Byrne said, the people responded. Together, the citizens of Kourend revolted, grabbing whatever they could use as a weapon. They fought the lizardmen.
notes: Some aspects of the story of the revolt's inception, such as the mutually conflicting accounts of the contents of his rousing speech, as well as its qualification as a "legendary" retelling, could indicate that the story may have been subject to later embellishments. If so, one could plausibly point to its status as a "heroic tale of defiance", the hypothesis being that it underwent rapid iterations as it spread throughout Kourend, soon gaining a life of its own, inciting rebellion with each unique retelling. A more cynical hypothesis could also be proposed which would explain the embellishments as intentional additions of a later date aiming to aggrandise Byrne's revolutionary exploits in order to help legitimise and solidify his new-found royal authority, and possibly deflect challenges from the established Kourend nobility, whom were formerly granted a claim to the throne by the Royal Accord. Byrne's tale of defiance would then be interpreted as a "foundational myth" serving to fulfil a need for royal justification.

quote: Xeric ruled Kourend for more than ten dark decades using an army of lizardmen.
During the battle, the temple surrounding the Dark Altar was destroyed, weakening Xeric's power.
The Dark Altar was the key to Xeric's power. Because of it, he was able to rule Kourend unopposed for nearly a hundred years.

Some say Xeric was actually killed during the revolt, but we have no record of his remains being discovered. (...) Xeric was incredibly powerful but we can reasonably assume that he soon perished. Without the power of the Dark Altar, Xeric would have become mortal.
The full set of laws within the Accord haven't been followed since. However, some of them were reinstated in the 47th decade, by King Byrne I.
Well at one time only citizens of Shayzien could join the army. It wasn't until the reign of King Byrne I that people from other parts of the kingdom were allowed to enlist.
The Royal Guard was established by King Byrne I. He felt that it was dangerous for Shayzien House to control the only military in the kingdom, so he decided to establish a small one of his own.
[Player: What is the symbol on the shrine?] You do not recognissse it, adventurer? It would ssseem hissstory is written by the winnersss, for that isss the sssymbol of the Great Lord Xeric.
Through their foul arts, they [the Calamity Coven] turned this Arena into a hotbed of corruption.
Maoma was a captain of the Emir's guard, but she abused her authority to rig fights so that the Coven would get rich at the people's expense.
Saika was the brains behind their operation, forging the Arena's accounts so that the Coven could keep all the profits, starving the Emir's public works of all funding.
Koriff used her charms to act as a gracious hostess, whipping up the crowds' excitement so that they'd gamble more and more unwisely, enriching the Coven.
This is the Emir's Arena, recently renovated with his coin.
The Emir of Al-Kharid has decreed that his Arena should be guarded, to stop ruffians like the Calamity Coven from returning.
Before Lovakengj, there was Imcandoria. Our ancestors there were forced to abandon their home, just as we were forced to leave Kourend.
Finally we have the dwarves. These were refugees from Lovakengj who established a home beneath Ralos' Rise, becoming known as the Dwarves of Cam Torum.
The Varlamorians won't mention this, but we were the first to settle here. Our ancestors saw the writing on the wall when Xeric came to power in Kourend. They chose not to stick around.
You have your virtues, but you have short sight and even shorter memories, which can be very dangerous.
I am a key advisor to Highlord Katlo himself. Few dwarves hold as much sway as I do. Not just anyone can authorise the entry of a human.

I work at the museum in Fortis. The dwarves have a begrudging alliance with the capital, and so they begrudgingly let me in. They demanded agreement to some absurdly expensive export deals in exchange, and even exclusive rights to some imports from the mainland. It took weeks of negotiation, and they still don't seem entirely satisfied.
Camorra came from the town of Saranthium
By Cap'n Hook-Hand Morrisane.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: The Little Book o' Piracy... By Cap'n Hook-Hand Morrisane... (an AMCE product)
The entrance below may be below the earth, but that realm lies beyond the reach of us mere mortals.
The Catacombs of Kourend are located beneath Great Kourend.
When I first encountered the elves on their homeworld of Tarddiad... ...one of their mystics, Ceidwad, documented my teachings in a great book called the Cerddi.
Each death was a blade through my heart, but none more so than Ceidwad, my closest companion. It didn't seem fair, didn't seem right.

They deserved more. I knew I had to give it to them... ...I found a way to share my essence with the elves, a piece of my being for each one of them. With this gift, their years would number in the thousands, time enough to live the lives they deserved.
When I first encountered the elves on their homeworld of Tarddiad, it was like I had finally found my purpose... ...Ceidwad, documented my teachings in a great book called the Cerddi.
name: Ceidwad

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Char * Designation: Unknown (See Notes) * Race: Auspah * Rank: Classified * Status: Unknown (See Notes) * Last Known Location: Arandar * Notes: Char has not been seen since shortly before Zamorak's betrayal, leaving her status and loyalties unknown.
Glough sent me to Karamja to meet him. I delivered a large amount of gold.

Glough paid me to go to this gnome on a hill. I gave the gnome a seal and he gave me some Daconia rocks to give to Glough. I've been doing it for weeks, this time though Glough locked me up here! I just don't understand it.
It's sad but I think Glough was right. Humans are planning to invade and wipe out the tree gnomes!
I've come to Kourend in search of luck, [player name]. I seek many fortunes and as you know you need luck to find fortune!
Ah these robes keeps me holy, I must remain holy when praying to the God of Luck
Arengeesus, God of luck. We do not know much about her or where she comes from, we just know she is there looking over us.
Those who praise Arengeesus enough to get her attention are rewarded. She will gaze down upon you providing you with luck on your adventures.
[Hard work is all you need.] Perhaps working hard is merely a form of praise to the God of luck, [player name].
The vampyre lord suffered the existence of Charos because of the talents that this sophisticated diplomat had to offer.

Indeed. Charos had many uses â spy, assassin, negotiator â because he could convince anyone to do his wishes. These talents were in some part Charos's own, but greatly enhanced by the ring that he fashioned.
One who wears the ring must possess some innate ability of their own, which the ring enhances so that the wearer can convince all but the most strong-minded to do their bidding.
Charos rose to power under the rule of Lord Drakan of Morytania; Charos was his only living servant.
Charos had a castle built on the northern coast of Morytania, where he dwelt for many years in service to Drakan.

None really know what became of him, but some say that he became too certain of his abilities, and turned them on his master. This would have been his ultimate downfall, for the ring's power would have had little or no effect upon Drakan.

[So what you are telling me is that nobody really knows what happened to Charos? That he could still be alive? And if he is still alive...] ...he would naturally come looking for the ring that is his by right. But I don't believe that you should worry about that â it has been many years since his disappearance, and the likelyhood is that he is dead.
[Player: What's the gold chest for?] Any items that are in the chest will be dropped inside the balloons when you pull the lever!
Awwww, chinchompas are great. They're highly volatile little balls of fluff. Cute as you like, but for some reason they do have this tendency to spontaneously combust.
Anyways, if you want to capture a chinchompa, I suggest using a box trap. That way, if the little fluffball does explode, then at least most of the blast will be contained within the box.
Probably something to do with the fact they'll eat anything and everything, especially spicy food.

[Player: Mr Oni...Dom, how did you get that name?] Well that's a long story...but I can tell you that it involved my parents, 3 blurberry specials, and a chinchompa. [Player: ...and a chinchompa?] Oh yes, Nigel played a crucial role in the whole debacle. It's all very amusing now that I think back to it.
It's most regrettable. Fortunately my innovation with my choc ice invention is helping people stay at least slightly cool.

I actually have this special magic box of ice, which I bought for a princely sum, from a strange man while adventuring in lands far away. He said it is imbued with some sort of powerful ice magic which keeps it cold all the time.
Come one, come all, buy my amazing choc ice invention here! Chocolate on the outside. Iced cream on the inside.
The people of Nardah seem to have taken well to the taste of chocolate and iced cream combined and, with the curse gone, all my friends are much happier too, so it's all good.
[Player: Choc-ice? Interesting.] Yes, it's a chocolate shell filled with a special ice cream made from camel milk.
I'd heard rumours that there was an Abbey up here somewhere, which sounded marvellous, but I seem to be in the wrong place.
Ever since the Ascent of Arceuus, our people have been kept alive by the Dark Altar. Its power sustains our bodies in the same way yours is sustained by food and drink.
Now if you excuse me, this conversation is... tiring. Being away from the Dark Altar has taken a greater toll on me than I expected.
It was a thousand years ago, during the time of King Byrne II. I went to my people and shared the secrets of immortality with them.
They came to us. Two of them. The brother and the husband. Her time was running out. They wanted to give her more.
Not all of [Arceuus] accepted this gift of course, as was their right. Those that did, were granted new bodies to house their souls. These bodies are sustained by the Dark Altar.
In the crypt below us, we freed our souls from the flesh-temples that had imprisoned them, and we took the form you see now.
The Altar is fine, but its power has been redirected. To a construct built by a mortal. Right next to the Altar.
My father was quick to act, using himself as a conduit to channel what little power the Altar had left.
Without the power of the Dark Altar, there's nothing to keep our people alive. The loss in power from the Altar will be what killed Thana.
For example, here in Fortis, you'll find yourself surrounded by Perican archetecture, whereas over in the Tlati Rainforest, the influence of the Talkasti remains clear.
They stole a suit of armour when they first broke in months ago, but they've been back four more times since then and taken nothing.
Up to now, our attempts to recover this scroll have been met with disappointment.
As the two groups came together, the population of the region started to rapidly expand. This eventually led to the construction of Tempestus, and with it, the founding of Varlamore.

In my travels throughout the Shining Kingdom, I have bested many mighty creatures. From the Colossal Wyrm of the Avium Savannah to the Cloud Titan of Tempestus, I am proud to proclaim myself as a master slayer.
The Kourend Royal Guard protect and serve the ruler of Kourend. As their leader, I am responsible for ensuring that the Royal Guard are well trained and well supplied.
Back when I was a girl, there was this Shayzien patrol that would go past our house each morning. Every day I would run out to wave at them as they went by.

For as long as I can remember, I always wanted to join the army. 'Become a farmer or a chef,' my parents would say to me. 'The army isn't for you.' But I knew what I wanted, and I knew nothing would stop me from getting it.

I remember a gang of thieves a few years back that used them heavily. The kids could get places the adults couldn't. No one ever suspected them either. They were such a problem that the Council had to get Lord Shayzien to send some soldiers in to deal with them. Lydia was one of them.
The Council had them all thrown in prison, even the children. Lydia was distraught.
I'm sure Lydia didn't tell you everything about herself either. We were together once, you know.
...she was ever loyal to the Council. In the end she decided I wasn't her type, and went off with that Captain Ginea instead. Of course, that didn't work out either.
Ah, so you're the adventurer who's been cooking up a storm around here. Well you'll be pleased to know your hard work was all for nothing. Councillor Hughes has escaped. Lucky her.

Alright, you can help. But for the duration of this investigation, you're working for me. What I say goes, [...] Right now we don't have any leads on where Councillor Hughes might have gone. I'm heading over to her home to see if there's anything there that can help us.
You have betrayed the trust of Yama, Sophia Hughes. You have used his generosity to your own advantage. For this, your life is forfeit.
Councillor Andrews may have been all nice to you, but he's furious with me. He's blamed me for what happened in Port Piscarilius.
You'd think they'd have some loyalty after all we did! After what we did to him. After what we did to his girl! We were in it together until it no longer suited them!
Martin. He's leader of Kourend's Royal Society. He knows more about the last royal family than anyone. If anyone can help you find Rose, it's him.

There was an Arceuus mage. He was an expert in curses, and he realised what was happening. He gave us the poison for the King. [...] By then, it was already too late. The King had deteriorated too much. There was only one solution.

The poison they gave her irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure. Someone else could make the potions, but all they do is prolong her suffering. This is no life for anyone. The truth is, Rose died long ago. All that's left now is an empty shell.
We, the leaders of the five houses of Great Kourend, declare that the Kourend Council is no longer fit to rule. As such, you are relieved of your positions with immediate effect.

Five hundred years have passed since the rule of King Alvis ... He founded the Consortium, the gathering of mining companies
that were to serve the monarchy
Eventually the monarchy came to serve the Consortium. By the time of his death, the monarchy was all but abolished. Now the Kings in Keldagrim are but a distant memory.
Following the rebellion of the five houses against King Rada III, the Council of Elders was formed.
Council of Elders: 6th BA - 1st BA
[The Council of Elders] used the Tower as a meeting place for the Council.
Only yesterday did I meet with the lords of all houses and we agreed in principle that all houses would offer half their land so we may farm more.
The Royal Accord of Twill was signed by the rulers of each of the houses 139 decades ago, following the great famine.
[I am here only to serve the mighty Drakan. Yup, Drakan, he's the man.] I see. I would perhaps be more inclined to believe you if I could not smell the death blood of his brother Draynor upon you.
Crop circle? Oh, you mean the Puromantic portal?
The greatest White Knights are buried here, after a lifetime in the service of Saradomin.
I am one of the seven teoki in service to Ralos.
It's choking me up right here, you're making me cry, but hey, I's godda do my job or da kids don't get fed!
An old statue of an ogre warrior.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: It's got the statue of Dalgroth. Welcome to Gu'Tanoth, friend of the ogres.
name: friend

quote: Well, what proof of friendship did you bring?
Our people also serves an important role in the wider world. We work to free trapped souls so that they may pass on to the next world. It is a crucial task that the Dark Altar helps us to perform.

Within [Mount Karuulm] live the Tasakaal, three ancient beings with power over life and death. They granted my father the knowledge that led to the Ascent of Arceuus. (...) Their knowledge of the Dark Altar far exceeds ours.
Our forebears spent their lives - literally, in some cases - learning to unlock its secrets and wield its power.
The power of the Dark Altar, reflected in these great crystals, can twist dimensions, warp minds, and even bridge the gulf between life and death.
The Dark Altar powers the Doors of Dinh.

It was a thousand years ago, during the time of King Byrne II. I went to my people and shared the secrets of immortality with them. Not all of them accepted this gift of course, as was their right. Those that did, were granted new bodies to house their souls. These bodies are sustained by the Dark Altar.
Hallowvale was taken over by my kind, and Lowerniel became ruler of the newly named Morytania.

Queen Efaritay was a renowned botanist. She used this to her advantage many times during the war, breeding all kinds of plant life to use against us. One of these plants was the Blisterwood tree. The icyene used the sap of this tree to create poisons that were deadly to vampyres.
No one can go in the Arboretum, by order of the Drakan family themselves.

The [Justiciar of the Unicorn] said he was going to confront these [vampyres] but that I should stay to protect the secrets within [the Hallowed Sepulchre]... I carried out my duties though. As we progressed further, we became more experienced at creating the traps. Each one was more deadly than the last. Eventually, when our work was done, I performed the last rites for each of my followers and sealed them within the coffins on the final floor.

Before they were driven out by the vampyres, the Saradominists used their magic to safeguard this place. The dead here were buried with the wealth they had in life. To protect these riches, the Saradominists enchanted the statues within the Sepulchre to create various defences.
Every day that goes by, the number of humans in Morytania decreases. Yet while this happens, our population continues to grow. Unsurprisingly, we no longer have enough blood to go around.

You have been gone too long, brother. While you spend your days hidden away, lamenting about that stupid rock, our kind suffer. Out there, in your city, they're starving. There's not enough blood to go around and their great leader is unwilling to provide a solution. Something has to change, or we're doomed.
Tell me, Vanescula. What is the cause of this latest betrayal? ...This veil of lies is thinner than the humans you feast upon. Now, the truth.
[Wizard Cromperty: Oh dear, it's such a bother getting them back out of the rock walls and I do loathe the trip to Port Khazard for the components.] What the demonikin are you talking about?
[Captain Bleemadge: I'm in need of some T.R.A.S.H.! And I need you to get it for me.] TRASH? What the demonikin are you talking about?
Who the demonikin is that? Is it meant to be a portrait of Sithik, it doesn't look anything like him!
Why the demoninikin are you waving THAT at me?
His lord had a beautiful daughter, Arastasia, with whom he was in love, but always he knew he would never win her hand.
That winter was the Great Winter which drew down the Wintertodt from the north, It proceeded to devour the animals upon the farm and freezing the next year's crops.
From devastated village to devastated village he travelled following the carnage of the Wintertodt.
name: Wintertodt

quote: I cannot bear to see you beautiful daughter cry so over the despair that this beast has caused.
if you succeed I will grant you my daughter's hand in marriage
Dressed in the Lord's best armour and wielding his most dangerous weapon Destristus started upon his quest.
Dentristus lay dead before he even saw the Wintertodt, the icy wind freezing him to the bone before he could lay a blow.
Callisto killed my father. After hearing of a great beast in the heart of the Wilderness, he took it upon himself to bring him down.
[Derwen] seems to take great interest in the other two creatures. Maybe he is trying to keep a balance between them.
Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj. He has fled to the west with his closest allies, but much of his army still remains. Carnifex Maximus Vardorvis is in pursuit of him.

Yes! Needed it for him, but not to keep! His friend asked him to protect it, but he made a new plan, a better plan![...]The old plan is gone. We're not doing it that way. His friend won't be happy, but it was for the best!
Hey, your cart has no donkey!
Yes, that would be because it's a rickshaw cart.
I want to go on the donkey rides, but there is too much sand in my bucket.
Gah! You play like a donkey, don't just sit there, get up and get the ball back!
Aha! Getting others to do the donkey work seems to be a skill that Mages develop well.

Arr, that's where ye'd be wrong lad/lass, 'cos new, improved Braindeath 'Rum' Classic is now 200% more disgustin' then any leadin' competitor! Legal disclaimer; the dangerous amount of disgustin' in new Braindeath 'Rum' Classic be too much for pregnant women, donkeys and anyone with more than seven letters in their last name.
She'd talk the hind legs off a donkey but she can select the iron with which it is suitable for the chicken to interact.
It's burnt, you dancing donkey!
You're right with that one [laddie/lass]. Someone or something has made a small hole in the Doors.
It's not much, but it's enough for that Wintertodt to be able to draw some power into the prison. Probably why them fiery lot have had so much trouble recently.

[Player: Does this mean the Wintertodt won't be a threat anymore?] That should be the case in the long run. I suspect it will take a long time though. The Doors were damaged for a while and the Wintertodt will have gained a lot of power. I reckon that magic lot will have to do their fiery tricks for a bit longer before everything is back to normal.
It seems that even by the time of the Civil War, our ancestors were beginning to lose their skills at making weapons..
The early Dorgeshuun must have used a much larger variety of weapons than we do now.
This was from the early days of Dorgesh-Kaan. It must have been before our ancestors' eyes reached their current size..
I graduated over 200 human years ago. Look, there's my Advanced Healing Certificate on the wall.
Only a few gave in to the anger of the curse. Only a few waged war on you.
Hosidius and Shayzien were the two cities founded during the Dragonkin Conflicts.
That dragonkin mentioned a weapon, one that could destroy us all. Betters something like that remains hidden.
After the battle, myself, Tristan and Camorra split the key into four pieces
Yes. [Galvek] has power that no other dragon has. The power to influence the minds of other dragons. Through him, an army will be raised. One that will annihilate humanity.
I also do voluntary work for the Draynor Manor Restoration Fund. We're campaigning to have Draynor Manor turned into a museum before the wet- rot destroys it completely.

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Mephitis * Designation: Ally * Race: Cthonian [sic] * Rank: Legatus * Status: Alive * Last Known Location: Paddewwa * Notes: Duke Mephitis leads the garrison at Paddewwa.

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Paddewwa * Designation: Location * Status: Under Allied Control * Notes: A large Bandosian force is marching on Paddewwa. Reinforcements will be needed there.

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Last Known Location: Paddewwa Vicinity * Notes: Graardor and his forces are marching on Paddewwa.
Half of the crest used to do so came into my possession, but it was seemingly taken by the Carnilleans after my defeat.
Player: That's a pretty wall hanging. Lilly: Do you think so? I made it myself [...] it's a hobby of mine when I'm.... relaxing.
Player: Umm... do you sell potions Lilly: Erm... yes. When I'm not drinking them.

In the face of inevitable death, a powerful shaman decided to lash out and inflict death on others. Her fellows disagreed with her actions. They created this prison, and they summoned me to watch over it.
but not after the wilful [sic] slaughter of over 800 civilians, as well as an equal number of White and Black Knights.
He earned the nickname 'Murder-mage' and 'Mad Solus' in the incident at Edgeville.
he was eventually apprehended by one of our field teams.

The charismatic Lord Daquarius was the youngest Black Knight to ever take lead of the Kinshra, being unanimously voted into leadership after the death of Lord Shadwell in the infamous incident at Edgeville.
My lord, this course of action will lead to very severe consequences! Your interference in Morytania will likely upset the balance and could send the world into another cataclysmic God War.
notes: âthis course of actionâ refers to invading Morytania.

quote: The Guthixian edicts govern spiritual balance, sire â perhaps these need closer study. In addition, we need to consider a reduction in the Guthixian influence we are forced to endure in our religious affairs.
The last descendant of the Halen line that I know of was a lady named Edwina. She married into the Fitzharmon family.

[Baxtorian: I did. But you don't understand, I loved my wife. If there was a chance of freeing her, I had to take it.] You think I don't understand love? I knew love, for Eirlys! My mother! Your daughter! She died in your war, while you hid away!
[ Arianwyn: Then I can take you back to Lletya. Your grandson, Islwyn, is there.] Grandson? So Eirlys had a child?
notes: Her first mention by name.

quote: It [the Elder Horn] grants absolute control. With this, one person has the power to bring entire armies to their knees, all without a single drop of blood being shed.

It's [a tablet] written by one of the crew on Perseriya's ship. Apparently they snuck into her private cabin... And found Imperium inside! This was after Imperium had already been delivered to the east!
This vault was sealed with magics that prevented beings like ourselves from opening it.

I want the Horn for all of us. Do you not see our fate? Over and over, we have our ritual. Over and over, we doom one of our kind to the endless void. It's all so... predictable. It's all so... tiresome. And in the end, it will be the death of us all. But the Horn will be our salvation. I will use it to break the cycle that has shackled us for so long. We will finally be free. The ritual approaches once more, but things will be different this time. This will be the final Ritual of the Mahjarrat.

'When I first encountered the elves on their homeworld of Tarddiad, it was like I had finally found my purpose. I quickly fell in love with them, and they with me. I set out to help them, to guide them.'
...I found a way to share my essence with the elves, a piece of my being for each one of them. With this gift, their years would number in the thousands, time enough to live the lives they deserved.

...With all my knowledge, I should have known not to meddle. That which I intended as a gift, soon turned out to be their curse. The song of creation increased their lifespans, but at a terrible price. It bound them to me. To stray too far from their sides, caused pain, and even death.

...Another being came to our world. Divine like myself, but not by design. He spoke of a perfect world, one filled with power. I knew it was a risk, but I decided to travel there. The power he spoke of might have been the only thing capable of saving the elves.
notes: While not named explicitly, the divine being in question is generally acknowledged to be Guthix.

quote: The power that filled the world was even greater than I had anticipated. A higher power, one I had not encountered for a long time. I was sure this world held the key to breaking the curse, I just needed to find it...

...It took millennia, but I finally made a breakthrough. Deep beneath the mountains near our home, I found a source of deathly energy. I was sure I could use this power to save them. My essence is of life, of light. This darkness would be the perfect counter, a way to nullify the curse.

I thought her essence would counter my own, ending the curse with her mere existence. It was not to be though. The curse was tied to me, not to her. I had failed, and she knew it. She turned on me, tried to destroy me.
I had to stop her, so I sealed her away, in the very place I had created her...
Elidinis is the goddess of fertility.
She is the Menaphite goddess of growth and fertility and goddess of the river.
notes: One of the three Spirits of the River Elid.

quote: The River Elid is named in her honour, for it brings life to the whole region.
There are some who even believe the river to be Elidinis herself.
...and goddess of the river
notes: One of the three Spirits of the River Elid.

quote: Then great Elidinis came to the desert and bound us to her river...
notes: One of the three Spirits of the River Elid.

quote: ...become one with the river and over the centuries become full of the power of Elidinis that was in her river.
notes: One of the three Spirits of the River Elid.

quote: [...] indeed Elidinis was allied with Saradomin many ages past. Saradominist mages even gave us these golems you met as a diplomatic gesture, so you can see we are on good terms;

My father [Osmumten] had a responsibility greater than most. At the time of his rule, our people were locked in a great war. To hold back the Ruinous Powers, our gods granted us immensely powerful weapons.
When the war was over, my father was tasked with hiding those weapons, lest they fall into nefarious hands. Two of them were buried with him.
The weapons in my father's tomb can be used to drain a being of divine energy and transfer that energy to another. If used correctly, they would grant the Devourer true godhood.
The four of them [Apmeken, Crondis, Het, and Scabaras] all came from Tumeken himself. Their power is his power. If she claims that power as her own, she will become a true goddess...
We helped her capture them. It took many lifetimes, but she was able to fool them all.

Ellemar's book said that Agrith Naar can only use his powerful magics from the demon plane. Ellemar must have trapped him in human form to stop him using his magics. That must be what the last pages of the book said.

You attacked us, tried to destroy us. You took away our homes, our people. Were we expected to stand by and watch?
[Bob the Cat: We were defending ourselves. You threatened to destroy us all.] Not all of us. Only a few gave in to the anger of the curse. Only a few waged war on you. But you were not willing to distinguish. And now, neither am I.
After your failed attempt on my life, I realised that we were starting to lose the war against your kind. We needed to turn the tide. We needed a new weapon.
The creature you call Elvarg was the first. An attempt to create a being which would crush humanity once and for all. She was a failure. Too weak. Pathetic.

Thirty years ago, Crandor was a thriving community with a great tradition of mages and adventurers. Many Crandorians even earned the right to be part of the Champions' Guild! One of their adventurers went too far, however. He descended into the volcano in the centre of Crandor and woke the dragon Elvarg.

Some refugees managed to escape in fishing boats. They landed on the coast, north of Rimmington, and set up camp but the dragon followed them and burned the camp to the ground. Out of all the people of Crandor there were only three survivors: a trio of wizards who used magic to escape. Their names were Thalzar, Lozar and Melzar.
I remember my father being very scared. He posted lookouts on the roof to warn if the dragon was approaching. All the city rulers were worried that Elvarg would devastate the whole continent.
The Iorwerth forces had the strength and safety of the city walls though. They slowly whittled us down until we were too weak to carry on. We had no choice but to retreat.
[Iorwerth] claimed Prifddinas as his own. Baxtorian tried to take it back from him, but Prifddinas was built to survive the God Wars. There was no way to retake it.
With Prifddinas lost to us, we returned to our kingdom in the east. We'd been gone for years by then.
We took our best fighters to Prifddinas, those that remained were unable to hold back the enemy.

It was the acts of humans that led my grandmother's death. (...) [Player: Your grandmother?] Glarial, wife to King Baxtorian. At one time my grandparents ruled over a great elven kingdom. But your kind put an end to that.
My wife was taken and most of my people were slaughtered. I turned my attention to finding my wife and getting the rest of my people to safety. [...] Lord Iorwerth became the least of my problems.
