Eventually, we managed to track her captors to some caves south of our ruined kingdom. It was clearly a trap, but I was a fool. I was so blind in my desire to find her, I didn't consider the obvious. [...] I sent my soldiers in, the few that I still had. They fought the best they could, but it was hopeless. They were massacred.

The enemy took [Glarial], so I searched far and wide to find her again. [...] At times I came close, but in the end, I was too weak to carry on. I knew there was a chance she may live though, so I sealed myself away, hoping she would be the one to wake me.
After that, I knew I couldn't carry on. I was alone and powerless. So I sealed myself away, in the hope that one day she would come back to me.
Anyway, with Baxtorian gone and Prifddinas lost, our land erupted into a Civil War. We've been fighting ever since.
The rebels have created a wonderful village here. A safe refuge from the tyranny of Lord Iorwerth.
After Baxtorian left to try and retake Prifddinas, my parents were among those who joined him. They never returned. I was still just a child at the time, alone and afraid.
notes: He is mentioned as Gollwyn's son in the book Gollwyn's final statement.

quote: For a long time now, we've believed that Lord Iorwerth has been trying to summon Zamorak, the Dark Lord.
I know my father is very grateful as well. If he were in better health, he would have thanked you personally. However at his age, it is best that he spends his time resting.
notes: post-quest dialogue

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Empyrean Citadel * Designation: Location * Status: Under Enemy Control * Notes: Armadyl commands his forces from the Empyrean Citadel.
Finally, I've been cutting down the same tree over and over again. I have level 15 Woodcutting now. I'm going insane.

Can you please help me? I'm in a terrible spot of trouble. My fiancÃ©, Ernest, and I came upon this house. Seeing as we were a little lost, Ernest decided to go in and ask for directions. That was an hour ago...and that house looks spooky. Can you go and see if you can find him for me?

Oh, he isn't normally a chicken, or, at least, he wasn't until he helped me test my pouletmorph machine. It was originally going to be called a transmutation machine, but after testing it, pouletmorph seems more appropriate.
Oh hello [player name]. I'm Aeryka. Aery for short. [Player: Airy Fairy?]
Have you seen Fairy Cake? She went to talk to the Godfather and I haven't seen her since.
After the Shayzien Army cleared out the lizardmen in this area, I founded this guild with some fellow Hosidius farmers.
The heat of the volcano allows us to grow things here that would never survive in the climate of Kourend. The discoveries we have made here are worth the extra risk.
At the end of the God Wars, the gods were banished from this world.

Firstly the Elves approached the Ogres and their kin to the south. Unfortunately without Bandos' guidance which had held these races together for millennia, the nation had fallen into a bloody civil war. Making any form of a treaty with each side useless.
name: elf

quote: Although at this time the Elves, Gnomes and Humans were living in peace, to the south, the war between the Ogres and their Goblin neighbours degenerated into an attempt at genocide of all Goblin races by the Ogres. This started a mass exodus of the Goblin races, they started to emigrate to the north along the coast moving through the lands not yet settled by the Elves.

Although the Goblin races were busy guarding their backs to the south and did not have the resources to start a war on two fronts, this did not stop them from forays for supplies into the Elven lands. [...] Within a few decades of 'The break out', the Elves had created many thriving settlements and a vast network of roads, despite the constant raiding from the Goblins.

But General Bloodfist of the Dorgeshuun refused to fight in this battle. Instead he commanded the Dorgeshuun army to march down into a fissure in the ground. General Bloodfist stood at the mouth of the fissure and defied the might of the evil god.
We've been cut off from other goblins for generations

This is more than just a place of spectacle. You stand in one of the holiest sites in all of Varlamore. Each drop of blood spilt here is a glorious offering to Ralos. It is these offerings that sustain him. Without them, he will not have the strength to light our way.
Scabaras is the god of isolation. (...) Both he and his followers were driven into hiding long ago.

During the early part of the fourth age, Scabaras proclaimed himself omnipotent and outlawed worship of all other gods save him. When the people eventually revolted against his repressive rule and banished Scabaras, it is said his blood washed over the scarabs and transformed them into the kalphites we know today.

[Player: But there must be more. The High Priest told me that Scabaras tried to conquer these lands.] So it is said, but the written accounts that exist contain many inconsistencies when it comes to what role Scabaras actually played.
We know for a fact that the dragonkin existed, they terrorised the world for many years during the early Fourth Age.
The first Druids of Guthix built many stone circles across these lands over eight hundred years ago.
Even before our forefathers founded Kourend, under King Rada I, they remembered the tumult of the times when the armies of the gods laid waste to the lands.

In the early part of the Fourth Age, of course, there were no permanent settlements. Tribes wandered the lands, staying where they could until the resources were exhausted. This changed as people learnt to grow crops and breed animals, and now there are very few of the old nomadic tribes. (â¦) One settlement was Avarrocka, a popular trading centre.

Did you know that Keldagrim was originally constructed by a long lost clan who embraced the power of magic, and used it to aid with glorious buildings like the royal palace? They even stayed down there for 1000 years or more, in a time they call 'The age of Kings'.

We dwarves went underground a long time ago, see. For a while the city of Keldagrim was completely cut off from the rest of Gielinor simply waiting out the wars of the humans and the gods.This made it hard, though, to determine when the wars above the ground were over. Perhaps Keldagrim had remained hidden for far too long. Only when King Alvis heroically defended the city against an invasion of trolls did we dare to venture out and see how much the world had changed.

You'll find books dating from many different eras as well, such as the Era of Kings, the Rise of the Consortium and the Era of Prosperity, our current era. [Player: How do these eras correspond with the Ages of the world?] Oh, they are quite different, and most of them take place in the Fourth Age.
Xeric ruled Kourend for more than ten dark decades using an army of lizardmen. This time period was known as the Age of Strife.
During the 47th decade, after ten decades of oppression, the people revolted against Xeric and his army of lizardmen. (â¦) The events were triggered through the courage of one man, Byrne.

Let us travel back in time, to the time you humans call the Fourth Age. King Healthorg had become King. The elves mysteriously decided to travel west, leaving most of Kandarin open for conquest. The humans weren't here yet, only King Healthorg and the gnomes to the north, and a collection of Goblin tribes to the south.

[Player: I think Oaknock died of old age some time ago. He must have visited you a few hundred years ago thoughâ¦] I keep forgetting, a hundred years is a long time for you. He was very interested in illusion magic, and how to prevent it. I gave him some advice and a few bits of equipment to help him.
He was one of King Healthorg the Great's advisors during the Grand Migration. But he was exiled after the Goblin Wars.
Oh, no no, we dwarves don't use magic. All of this is powered by steam engines, developed over the past few centuries after the Consortium came to power.

According to this there was a family by the name of Corvo living in Avarrocka for most of the Fourth Age. The last entry is from the year 1770 of the Fourth Age. [Player: What happened to them?] Impossible to say for sure but it was around that time that many people left Misthalin to settle in Morytania. (â¦) Port Phasmatys is where most of the Morytania settlers wound up.

Necrovarus told us that he had been brought by a vision he'd had of an underground source of power. He inspired us to delve beneath the town, promising us the power to repel the vampyres. (â¦) Indeed, this Ectopower did repel the vampyres; they would not enter Phasmatys once the Ectofuntus began working. But little did we know that we had exchanged one evil for yet another â Ectopower. Little by little, we began to lose any desire for food or water, and our desire for the Ectopower grew until it dominated our thoughts entirely. Our bodies shrivelled and, one by one, we died.
[Player: Nice place you've got here.] It is, isn't it? It was built over 230 years ago.
Jatizso ventured far into uncharted oceans, [...]
Four generations ago there was a mighty king who ruled wisely and was loved by all. He had many sons, [...]. His youngest two sons, however, were a problem.
Their names were Jatizso and Neitiznot.
As punishment for their squabbling he banished his sons from his realm, ordering that neither should return until they had conquered lands of their own.
At last a promising land was sighted, a land rich in minerals, deep fjords and sweeping mountains.
Jatizso claimed the land and named it after himself.
A mighty citadel was constructed to protect his land; then Jatizso set forth to explore his new kingdom.
Crossing a few fjords, Jatizso spied an island which remained green and fertile, even at such latitude.
Jatizso was horrified when his brother appeared on the battlements and cried 'This is my land! Go find yer own'.
And so the blood feud continued.
Quite recently a massive troll army seized one of the islands to the north, while our townships' militias were busy fighting one another.
They marched down and razed Neitiznot to the ground while Neitiznot's troops laid siege to Jatizso.
Anyway, the Burgher lost his wife and youngest son in the trolls' raid and has been a changed man since.
Anyway, a hasty sort of peace has been agreed until the trolls are dealt with.
Dragon swords! Here, Dragon swords! Straight from Frenaskrae!
The Frostenhorn has the ability to amplify power to potentially unimaginable levels.
notes: as "Mysterious Voice"

quote: The Frostenhorn has been missing since the loss of the Pontifex Maximus. It was removed from Senntisten by unknown individuals. Status unknown.
And in answer to your question, the Frostenhorn was destroyed.[...]It was during your little excursion to Ghorrock Prison.
The Frostenhorn was one of three powerful items I was seeking. Together, they may have been my best chance to determine the fate of my lord.
Had that not happened, the throne would have eventually passed down to... Furia, I think... I believe she's the slightly older of the two.
I AM Sir Galahad. Although I've retired as a Knight, and now live as a solitary monk. Also, I prefer to be known as Brother rather than Sir now.
Be careful in there, there are still some of those baby Tanglefootii around.

loc: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin generals
quote: Hmmm... neither of them were at the previous council meeting. [...] I heard the last leader died during a game of pin the tail on the basilisk.
This big important secret meeting that Franizzard cooked for is held here in Lumbridge castle every 10 years

loc: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin generals
quote: Hmmm... neither of them were at the previous council meeting. [...] I heard the last leader died during a game of pin the tail on the basilisk.
This big important secret meeting that Franizzard cooked for is held here in Lumbridge castle every 10 years
His family had been rich, shipping all sorts of goods up and down the coast.
Then their rivals got together and had their ships sunk, one after the other, and his business partners were all either bought off or had...accidents.
With no money and only one ship left, he took to the life of a pirate, but no brigand was he.
He took only from those men that had brought about his downfall, was fair with his men, and generous with his loot.
Why, this island would have been wiped out by the shakes if he hadn't turned over his stash to buy medicine.
One day his ship was attacked by a huge sea creature that swept the decks of men with its tentacles.
The crew took to the lifeboats, and the last they saw of him the gentleman was stabbin' at the thing as it hauled the ship under the water.
A week later about ten foot of tentacle washed up on the beach, with his rapier embedded in it to the hilt. I took it, cleaned it up, and I've been lookin' after it ever since.
Before the God Wars, a settlement of the old empire was found here.
notes: as Big Fish (Hazeel)

quote: The fortress to the east is all that remains on the surface, but there is much still hidden below.
notes: as Big Fish (Hazeel)

quote: We're blind here. My senses do nothing this close to the ritual marker.
notes: as Dead Wolf (Khazard)

quote: A great prison, sealed long ago.
notes: as Big Fish (Hazeel)

quote: But to risk unleashing an abomination of the Fallen Empire when the ritual is so close would not be wise.
The Giant Mole (Talpidae Wysonian)
notes: West wing, Display case #7

quote: [Player: What's 'Gielinor'?] It is the name that Guthix gave to this world, so we honour him with its use.
Myriad and beautiful were the creatures and civilizations [sic] of the early ages of the world. Gielinor was a work of art, shaped lovingly over the millennia by the creative mind of Guthix.

Cats are easily as tough as sheep. Cats were the second thing Guthix brought here, after sheep of course. [Player: Weird. I thought Gnomes and the Dwarves were the first ones. Oh well back to school for me.]
Another being came to our world. Divine like myself, but not by design. He spoke of a perfect world, one filled with power. I knew it was a risk, but I decided to travel there.
I'm afraid not. We need all of our milk to sell to market, but you can milk the cow yourself if you need the milk.
Tee hee! You've never milked a cow before, have you?
Gnome Air is the finest airline in Gielinor! Well, it's the only real airline in Gielinor. Ha!

They did mention that an old gnome engineer called Oaknock used to make model gliders for his children. Oaknock's son, Yewnock, ended up creating this method of transport with inspiration from his father's models.

I don't think Ali is prepared to take on Gnome Air just yet. Their gliders are much faster than our carpets. Besides that, I think we are in the short-haul business, something that would only work in harsh conditions like the desert.
[Player: Those nets are strange.] Ah, made from the finest thread in all the land. [Player: And that is?] Gnome hair.
Once Nex was no longer an immediate threat, they built the Temple of Lost Ancients around her. Most of the temple has since fallen to ruin, but you can still see some of the remains.
It's not a distinction the Fremennik particularly care for. To us, he has always been a hero to be respected, not a god to be worshipped. They say he felt the same way.
Well, this one time I found this spooky old temple in the middle of the jungle.
Well anyway, I found the secret entrance, fought my way in through the zombies and tribesmen, and came to a big pedestal with a statue of solid gold sat on top of it!
Well, while he was screaming and waving his sword around, I stood behind a nearby stalactite, then shot him with my shortbow.
(...) a statue of solid gold sat on top of it!
Well, that's where you'd be wrong. I work for the Archaeological Society of Varrock, and have been excavating around here recently.
Be extremely careful, their [Gorak] touch drains health as well as skills!
Goraks drain the life from their prey, so by using one of their claws we are hoping to draw the Queen's life essence back.
The fairy rings can take you to the plane that the Goraks are imprisoned on. Be careful, they are extremely dangerous creatures.
Goraks are extremely aggressive creatures. They have been imprisoned on an alternative plane, which is only accesible by using the fairyrings.

Know that before the Council of Elders, for the health of our soul and those of our ancestors and heirs, and the better ordering of our kingdom, at the advice of Ethrain Hosidius, Seabry Shayzien, Ret Piscarilius, Solange Lovakengj and Bourath Arceuus all royal Lords of our kingdom.
Indeed it was; in the thirteenth decade, King Shayzien III seized control of Kourend using the military under his command.

Third, that of this day one member from the royal lords of our kingdom whom are part of the great houses of Hosidius, Lovakengj, Shayzien, Piscarilius and Arceuus shall be chosen to be the Grand Lord of Kourend
Grand Lord of Kourend for a period of no more than 10 years

able to exercise authority over any action, collection of revenues, mobilisation of armies, distribution of revenues, seizure of goods or chattels belonging to any free man of the kingdom or any other thing as may be considered in the interest of the kingdom

Upon the expiry of these 10 years he will willingly pass the title of Grand Lord to the royal lord of our Kingdom whom is part of the great house of Lovakengj for a period of no more than 10 years. And so it shall continue for the royal lord of our kingdom whom is part of the great house of Shayzien, then for the royal lord of our kingdom whom is part of the great house of Piscarilius and finally for the royal lord of our kingdom whom is part of the great house of Arceuus.
Henceforth this is known as the Right of Succession to the Office of Grand Lord.

if a suitable male lord of any of the royal lords of our kingdom whom are part of the great houses of Hosidius, Lovakengj, Shayzien, Piscarilius and Arceuus cannot be found at the start of their period as Grand Lord, whether due to infirmity of the mind or body or of questionable morality the Right of Succession to the Office of the Grand Lord is annulled and passed to the next royal lords of our kingdom whom are part of the great houses of Hosidius, Lovakengj, Shayzien, Piscarilius and Arceuus.
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.

The five houses of Kourend each have their own leader who rules over their city. The leaders of the individual houses must enforce and obey the laws set out by the Kourend Council, but can otherwise rule as they see fit.
Hosidius and Shayzien were the two cities founded during the Dragonkin Conflicts.
Most of our history was lost during Xeric's reign.
The Tower was constructed by King Rada III. We don't know exactly when, since dates were not recorded before the Twill Accord.
I know of the powerful magic that keeps them [the creatures] bound below [within the Catacombs].
In the 13th decade, King Shayzien III seized control of Kourend using the military under his command.
[The son of King Shayzien VI] took the name King Hosidius IV in an attempt to distance the family from the breaking of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Alas, according to records, the party never returned and were declared to have perished in the field.

This [Unstable Altar], it seems to give off the same power as the Dark Altar. I believe this altar was created to amplify the power of the Dark Altar, allowing it to reach areas it previously couldn't.
'Quidamortem's creatures are compatible. The experimentation is proving successful and we will soon be ready to mass produce.'
During the battle, the temple surrounding the Dark Altar was destroyed, weakening Xeric's power.
The Royal Guard was established by King Byrne I. He felt that it was dangerous for Shayzien House to control the only military in the kingdom, so he decided to establish a small one of his own.
Well at one time only citizens of Shayzien could join the army. It wasn't until the reign of King Byrne I that people from other parts of the kingdom were allowed to enlist.
It was a thousand years ago, during the time of King Byrne II. I went to my people and shared the secrets of immortality with them.
They came to us. Two of them. The brother and the husband. Her time was running out. They wanted to give her more.
Not all of [Arceuus] accepted this gift of course, as was their right. Those that did, were granted new bodies to house their souls. These bodies are sustained by the Dark Altar.
Forthos was the seat of the Hosidius family before it was destroyed in the War of the Five Houses.
Apparently they [Arceuus] didn't even properly fight in the War of the Five Houses. Still, I guess 'War of the Four Houses while House Arceuus watched' isn't as catchy a name.

He had the servants open a barrel of his finest Aldarin red. Then, he made a toast, to the royal family of Kourend... The entire royal family collapsed before the emperor who looked on with a smile on his face.
From today, the sun will shine on our two kingdoms once more. The mistakes of the past are now behind us.
[The King is] keen to put an end to the animosity between the two kingdoms. Rumor has it [Queen Zyanyi Arkan] feels the same way.
[King Kharedst] married late and his wife... Unfortunately didn't survive bringing Rose into this world.
Are you saying the man I sold those trinkets to was the king?! Those were dark objects, corrupted with powerful magic. Dark magic.
The flask was cursed. Some dark magic. He stopped being himself. Started saying things. Things he would do to people. To the citizens!
There was an Arceuus mage. He was an expert in curses, and he realised what was happening. He gave us the poison for the King.
By then, it was already too late. The King had deteriorated too much. There was only one solution.
Kourend's last King, Kharedst IV, had only one child when he died. She was too young to take the throne, so the Kourend Council was formed to look after things until she came of age.
We didn't want to kill her. She didn't deserve that. The mage gave us a potion. He said it would stop her revealing the truth.
I did some research while you were gone. [Councillor Orson] wasn't lying. The poison they gave [Rose] irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure.
Alas, she was very close to her father and his sudden death drove her to insanity.
After what happened, public life was no place for her. The Council arranged for her to move away so she could escape all of that.
With no suitable ruler, the Kourend Council was made permanent.
[What makes you say the Council have done a bad job?] More crime. Fewer homes. More illness. Loss of jobs. The list goes on.

You know that smell in Port Piscarilius? Imagine that but ten times worse. That's what it was like before the Council had a new sewage system installed. The entire kingdom is now cleaner and safer because of them.
It was under [the Council] that trade with your lands to the east was established. Without those trade routes, you would have no easy way of getting here.

After the last King died, they [the Council] were only supposed to rule until his daughter came of age. However, according to the Council, the King's daughter went mad. Such a wonderful convenience for them of course.
The Council is supposedly voted on by the people every four years. However, the seats have been held by the same four people since the Council was founded.
Ah, so you're the adventurer who's been cooking up a storm around here. Well you'll be pleased to know your hard work was all for nothing. Councillor Hughes has escaped. Lucky her.
I hear the Kourend Royal Guard are leading the investigation. Commander Lydia Fullore is their leader.
You have betrayed the trust of Yama, Sophia Hughes. You have used his generosity to your own advantage. For this, your life is forfeit.
You'd think they'd have some loyalty after all we did! After what we did to him. After what we did to his girl! We were in it together until it no longer suited them!
Martin. He's leader of Kourend's Royal Society. He knows more about the last royal family than anyone. If anyone can help you find Rose, it's him.

Councillor Andrews isn't happy. This is the first time I've directly asked him to perform a task for me. Still, he soon calmed down after a little reminder of who gave him the throne. After all, he wouldn't want the others finding out he was in on it from the start.

[David] placed the device right next to the Altar, just as requested. That said, I likely won't have long to acquire and store the energy needed. The device will no doubt interfere with the ascended humans of Arceuus. They will soon realise something is amiss.

The poison they gave her irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure. Someone else could make the potions, but all they do is prolong her suffering. This is no life for anyone. The truth is, Rose died long ago. All that's left now is an empty shell.
The people should have a say. Anything we decide here should not be finalised until the people have voted on it.

My friends, thank you for putting your trust in me. This kingdom has suffered through much of late, but now it is time for that suffering to end. In honour of her sacrifice, I name this declaration Rose's Accord. With it, the Kingdom of Great Kourend will no longer be a kingdom divided.

We, the leaders of the five houses of Great Kourend, declare that the Kourend Council is no longer fit to rule. As such, you are relieved of your positions with immediate effect. Furthermore, you will both hand yourselves over to Lord Shayzien's soldiers. They will take you into custody where you will await your trial for the crimes of murder and high treason. Along with the now-deceased Liam Orson and Sophia Hughes, the two of you successfully conspired to murder King Kharedst IV and Crown Princess Rose.
The King's late father asked for an advisor from Arceuus. He was keen for us to have a more central role than we did under the Council.

When the people voted on Rose's Accord, they voted for the Hosidius family to become the new royal family. From a technical standpoint that means they voted for King Artur. My job is to advise King Artur and ensure his actions have a positive impact on the people that he now rules.
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Very little is known about those ancient times [before the signing of the Accord], but we refer to such times as decades 'Before Accord', or 'BA' for short.
...as this is the Historical Archive, we stick to the dates used historically within Kourend.
Saradomin is popular with many uneducated citizens of Kourend.
I am a travelling monk from the distant land of Varlamore... I worship Ralos, a common practice where I am from.
While the gods are useful for tedious matters such as granting prayers during combat, we of Arceuus have long moved beyond the need to pay them homage.
This is a place of meditation, where a novice may contemplate the mysteries of the Dark Altar - without venturing too close to its power.
...you may use our church to worship any god you prefer. That would be an ecumenical matter.
We Menaphites are believers in many gods. I, in my position as head priest of Icthlarin, still give praise to Tumeken and Elidinis each day at this very altar.
The ninth version was built using magic logs. The barge gained some form of rudimentary sentience. It developed serious depression and ran itself aground near Crandor.
Grimgnash not give food names. Does human call a carrot jasper or something?
We guards usually stay by banks and shops, but I got sent all the way out here to keep an eye on the brigands loitering just south of here.
Tell me, is the guard still watching us?

I'll have you know it's a very important job guarding this jail! If anyone comes sneaking in here to mess around with the prisoners, the lads downstairs will make mincemeat of them, and I'll be here to pick them off if they try to escape. [Player: You mean people aren't meant to be able to shoot the prisoners in the cells?]
In time, a warrior called Gunnar took his friends and their families and left the larger tribe

Some of our young, wishing to try so-called 'civilisation' and the softness of city life, abandon the tribe and move to the cities. It is sad to see them go, but we do not prevent them; we live here in our village because we love this life - we do not force it on those whom it does not suit.
Our current chieftain, Gunthor the Brave, is a direct- line descendent of Gunnar.
Guthix is the oldest and most powerful god in Gielinor. His existence is vital to this world. He is the god of balance, and nature; he is also a very part of this world.
Silence fell, for the gods knew that none could challenge the power of the mighty Guthix -- for His power is that of nature itself, to which all other things are subject, in the end.
[Player: What's 'Gielinor'?] It is the name that Guthix gave to this world (...)

...Another being came to our world. Divine like myself, but not by design. He spoke of a perfect world, one filled with power. I knew it was a risk, but I decided to travel there. The power he spoke of might have been the only thing capable of saving the elves.
notes: While not named explicitly, the divine being in question is generally acknowledged to be Guthix.

quote: Myriad and beautiful were the creatures and civilizations of the early ages of the world. Gielinor was a work of art, shaped lovingly over the millennia by the creative mind of Guthix.

In time the noise of the conflict woke Guthix from His deep slumber, and He rose and stood in the centre of the battlefield so that the splendour of His wrath filled the world, and He called for the conflict to cease!

Guthix reclaimed that which had been stolen from Him, and went back underground to return to His sleep and continue to draw the world's power into Himself. [...] But on His way into the depths of the earth He sat and rested in this cave; and, thinking of the battle-scarred desert that now stretched from one side of His world to the other, He wept. [...] And so great was His sorrow, and so great was His life-giving power, that the rocks themselves began to weep with Him.
I worship Guthix, the god of balance.
The Void Knights, they are great warriors of balance who do Guthix's work here in Gielinor.
Cats were the second thing Guthix brought here, after sheep of course.
name: cat

quote: Long ago, the land of Morytania was known as Hallowvale and it was ruled over by a race of Saradominists called the icyene.
Hallowvale was taken over by [the vampyres], and Lowerniel became ruler of the newly named Morytania.
The family of icyene that ruled over Hallowvale were the Hallow family. And so of course, the name of the region is no coincidence.
Marrying one of her [icyene] standing brings some privilege. As such, we were able to hold the ceremony in the shadow of the Acropolis.

Lord Zamorak and his trusted compatriots, namely myself, Hazeel, Drakan, Thammaron and Zemouregal made plans to overthrow our lord using the god-weapon, and by pledging allegiance to Zamorak as our master, were each to be given a large piece of land as our own in return.

Queen Efaritay was a renowned botanist. She used this to her advantage many times during the war, breeding all kinds of plant life to use against us. One of these plants was the Blisterwood tree. The icyene used the sap of this tree to create poisons that were deadly to vampyres.

The [Justiciar of the Unicorn] said he was going to confront these [vampyres] but that I should stay to protect the secrets within [the Hallowed Sepulchre]... I carried out my duties though. As we progressed further, we became more experienced at creating the traps. Each one was more deadly than the last. Eventually, when our work was done, I performed the last rites for each of my followers and sealed them within the coffins on the final floor.

Before they were driven out by the vampyres, the Saradominists used their magic to safeguard this place. The dead here were buried with the wealth they had in life. To protect these riches, the Saradominists enchanted the statues within the Sepulchre to create various defences.
The war for this land was long and bloody. We were winning, but with heavy losses.
Lowerniel didn't mind. He was a hunter and a warrior. In his eyes, there was no death more noble than one in battle.
[Ranis] managed to infiltrate Efaritay's castle. Once inside, he captured [King] Ascertes.
Efaritay surrendered that same day. She walked into Lowerniel's camp, alone, and willingly handed herself in. I guess she had hoped that Lowerniel would free your father in exchange for her.
After [Efaritay surrendered], I'm afraid I don't know what happened to your mother. No one ever saw her again. Only Lowerniel himself knows her fate.

...we suffered heavy losses in the war. We needed a way to quickly restore our numbers. Vampyrification was the answer. [Ascertes] was the first of many to go through the process. He still lives to this day, under a different name of course. Vanstrom Klause.
Player: That's a pretty wall hanging. Lilly: Do you think so? I made it myself [...] it's a hobby of mine when I'm.... relaxing.
Player: Umm... do you sell potions Lilly: Erm... yes. When I'm not drinking them.
I did not betray our lord like Apropos did, nor did I cowardly sit on the fence like Hannibus.
name: Ablenkian

quote: Hannibus fled Senntisten early in the war and is the only remaining ilujanka traitor to be unaccounted for.
Oh my aching feet! A chair! Just what I've been needing! I'm going to go sit by the fountain, so pretty this time of year.
I reckon Hans could do with a sit down as he's always on his feet.
All his rituals came from a book written by an ancient sorcerer from the East called Haricanto.

By my brothers and sisters and by those who swore to battle by my side. I pledged my service to the Empty Lord and I never wavered, even as I was warned of his downfall. I think perhaps I should have. For those who I once named as allies, have turned against me. Why? Many of them are alive only because of the actions of me and my steed Hekala.
name: Ablenkian

quote: At the battle of Carrallanger I rescued Corveth from the flames that threatened to consume her. I dove my dragon deep into the flames, though the heat would mark my flesh forever, and I grasped her hand before the tower collapsed beneath her.
I doubt even they could stand up to the raw power of my dragon. But she is gone. Murdered by Corveth and her treachery.
They were grown here back when this place was still known as Hallowvale. The Saradominist Queen of the region used them as weapons against the vampyres.
When we created the Maiden, we experimented heavily in that area.
Precisely that! Specifically the hespori. Their bark has wonderful regenerative abilities.
He is the very incarnation of health in both mind and body. He is quite popular amongst our soldiers as a result. [...] Our greatest memory masters and orators also tend to follow Het.
Het is the lesser deity concerned with mental and physical health. Sophanem is the city of the dead so Het isn't really worshipped much here.
As you can imagine, the services can be home to some strenuous discussions. [...] They really couldn't decide whether it was a punishment from Het or a curse and an affront to Het.
The pathetic new high priest of Icthlarin [is in charge].
I'll admit that I shed no tears when he passed away. He was a rather cruel and hard leader.
It's my first week on the job and already I've had an outbreak of plagues, half the population has fled the town and, to top it off, some adventurer has desecrated the tomb of the old high priest.
When the plague first broke out, many of the resident tradespeople fled before the priests of Icthlarin decided to quarantine the city to prevent the plague being passed on to others living nearby.
I am a librarian from the great library of Menaphos. I left to travel the desert and learn more of its history. Unfortunately, the plague in Sophanem prevents me from returning to the library.

Well, it all started the day that the plagues broke out here. I had gone into Menaphos in the morning to get some flour and chocolate powder and, when it came time for me to return, the gates were shut.

High Priest: Can you please hurry up? The people are beginning to...erm... 
Player: What? Question your sanity? 
High Priest: Um...well, no, just my authority.
It never ends; as soon as I think we have it won, The Devourer catches us off our guard again.
We're doing a bit. Having Nardah and Pollnivneach nearby helps and we're also getting a lot of trade from adventurers these days. Still, I look forward to when Menaphos opens its gates to us again.

The new high priest used to be a bit of a wet towel. He was very unsure of himself and had little respect from the people of the town. Yes, well, since the townspeople have returned, they've a lot more confidence in him and I think he may have gained some more self-belief.
I am a key advisor to Highlord Katlo himself. Few dwarves hold as much sway as I do. Not just anyone can authorise the entry of a human.
Ah, well I'm glad you asked. My most prized possession to date: Through my connections, I managed to acquire a horn-less Unicorn! [Player: Really? That's amazing! A unicorn without a horn?]
[Player: I'd like a horse, please.] No horses in Gielinor. Try again.
[If you're a nightmare, would a male version of you be a nighthorse?] What's a horse?

Nope, tastes mighty fine! Any chance you *hic* know where Horses go? [Player: The what?] The Horses! [Player: Ah, the 'Horses'... How unfortunate, the wine has made you delirious. I've no idea what a Horse is my friend.]
Woah woah woah, hold your horses there friend! I can't just eat anything. I have very specific dietary requirements.
Hold yer horses, [lad/lass]! While ye was off gallivantin' with yer slimy aquatic playmates, the 'rum' achieved spiritual critical mass.
Guthix be praised, the cavalry has arrived! Hero, how would you like to be made an honorary member of the Black Guard?
Ah wondrous creatures, ships of the desert, far more useful than any horse or donkey. A man's best friend.
A horse? I know people talk about them, but I'm not at all sure they ever existed. I don't think I could let you use one as your symbol unless you can fetch me some kind of model of one.
Ah, I see you've brought a toy horse for me to see. An interesting beast. Certainly you can use that as your crest if you like, although it seems a bit strange to me.
Well, there is a long standing rule of chivalry amongst the Varrockian aristocracy, where each noble family is in possession of a unique crest, which signifies the honour and lineage of the family.
We are true knights who fight for honour. Those Black Knights didn't fight fair, so we were unprepared. Most unchivalrous of them.
Ugh, of course not. The fool says he won't fight a woman. That demon thinks he's a pillar of chivalry.

Some say he cannot die, for he has hidden his heart outside of his body to be kept forever safe in a duck egg. Others say he has been cursed by the gods to wander this land forever, never knowing any peace in his life, but only combat. Some claim that the sword he carries is the source of all his power, and if he should lose it, then exactly one minute later, he will turn back into his true form; A weakened, lame, old man. [Player: And what do you believe?] I believe you shouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth.

loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
quote: Horses Designation: Error Status: Error Last Known Location: Error Notes: ??????????
Gor blimey wot's next? [Wise Old Man: The most important bit! Collecting the toys from Diango and paying for them.] Who's goin ta pony up?
[Player: Any idea what it could be?] None at all, this is exciting! What could it be... a hornless unicorn? Pumpkin pie? A party hat?
Ho Ho Hold your horses! You're not allowed in there.
Oh sorry... Also what's a horses?

You hop into the cart and the driver urges the horses on. You take a taxing journey through the jungle to Shilo Village. You feel tired from the journey, but at least you didn't have to walk all that distance.
Did you hear the one where the camel walks into the bar and orders a pint? The barman asks 'Why the long face!'.
We're mobilising people and we're starting out own society... cleaning out the caves once inhabited by these foul creatures and defending them so that they can never again shelter sub-human species.
Do we have to deal with the dwarves? They may not exactly be monsters, but they're still not human.
While great, our power is insignificant compared to a true god. That is why they are gone, and we remain.
Tumeken made them [Icthlarin and Amascut] too. Difference is, they also have some of Elidinis' divine essence, making them a lot more powerful!

loc: The Curse of the Empty Lord
quote: The powerful god, lived in the North-east. Took the Mahjarrat away from under Icthlarin's control.

He once even was worshipped by the Mahjarrat but they turned away from him in the Third Age to follow Zamorak. Or maybe it was Zaros to whom they turned; it was a long time ago and not that important.
The Devourer has taken to destroying humans. [...] Not just killing them; totally destroying them, body and soul. This has brought her into conflict with Icthlarin.

The Devourer was so in love with death and destruction that she even started destroying her own worshippers. We tolerated this until she even started to destroy her own temples and clergy. The last of her priestesses gathered and cursed her. Unfortunately she also cast a spell of her own, condemning us to an eternity of walking RuneScape in her form. [...] We cursed her so her name would be forgotten, that any corporeal body she adopted would soon cast her out and never again would she gather willing worshippers.
It is not in Icthlarin's best interest to let us die, so we will never die of natural causes.
I ensure the survival of cats and, for this service, Icthlarin grants me eternal life. [...] I look after my kind and, for that, Icthlarin looks after me.
Icthlarin is limited in what he can do. His duties to the dead require constant attention.

So pleased was he with me that he promoted me on the battlefield once to serve as his honour guard, and let me tell you, this was a rare honour indeed, for I was the only human chosen to take such a position. Oh yes, the dragon riders, Mahjarrat, demons and vampyre warriors made up the bulk of the force, but I wager I was their equal in all ways of combat.
It all started around 100 years ago when Imafore Tullus ascended to the throne.
While public opinion was always mixed, nothing he did resulted in outright conflict until his sudden and brutal murder of the Kourend Royal Family. War was quickly declared.

Imafore soon found himself facing as much resistance from within as he did from Kourend. The end result was predictable. Imafore and his forces found themselves trapped between two armies at the Battle of the Proudspire. He was captured and executed, bringing an end to the Tullus dynasty.

King Mezpah Arkan. One of his first acts was to call for the beheading of every statue of Imafore in the kingdom. The statues remain to this day. It's actually a crime to try and remove them. They exist as a reminder of our history, and a warning to any who would try to follow in Imafore's footsteps.
To answer that, our best bet would likely be to seek out the creators of the shield: The Imcando Dwarves of Camdozaal.
Rumour has it [the Imcando] once lived in a great city in the far north.
The city [Imcandoria] fell and now they are homeless.
It seems [the Imcando] have been promised a new home here in return for wiping us out.
Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj. He has fled to the west with his closest allies, but much of his army still remains. Carnifex Maximus Vardorvis is in pursuit of him.
The Varlamorians won't mention this, but we were the first to settle here. Our ancestors saw the writing on the wall when Xeric came to power in Kourend. They chose not to stick around.
When it comes to the existence of Varlamore, it is Xeric we have to thank. During his Age of Strife, many refugees fled Kourend over the previously unexplored Custodia Mountains.
I recall encountering a particularly nasty demon capable of summoning torrential rainstorms in the Avium Savannah. Being requested by a group of dwarves underground to quell the demon's rage...
...[the Imcando dwarves] forged me a silver sword combined with some mystical metal, which they claimed was carefully tuned to greatly harm demons.
Our methods would often differ from other dwarves. Whereas they just used traditional smithing techniques, we would combine them with magic as well.
We used our advanced Smithing knowledge to improve their form. Eventually, we were able to get them working again. We kept pushing with the golems. Many of them we imbued with magical energies.
Camdozaal was built upon the ruins of an older civilization. Little trace of them remained by the time we arrived. However, when building the city, ancient golems were discovered.

We learned of a horde of barbarians pillaging across the land, hunting down and killing anyone who dared use magic. We underestimated them. We believed our weapons would be enough to keep us safe. We were wrong. The barbarians brought ruin upon Camdozaal.
Rumour has it [the Imcando] once lived in a great city in the far north.
I had found a lot of trade scrolls with early Fremennik tribes on the isle [of Garmr] too...
One of the acolytes discovered a strange idol along the beach today, it has the oddest markings scratched upon it, much akin to the runic rocks of the Fremennik.
The Elders of Imcandoria will know what to do with such a relic so the other Seers and I have agreed that it will be sent to them immediately.
It has been two moons since we sent the idol away and the storms have turned increasingly ferocious. We have gone below into the lower Necropolis, hoping to seek refuge in the Forge of Giants.
The giants allowed us to stay in their domain. However, our time here is limited by our food stores, for no edible food can be produced in these horrible depths.
In three moons we will return to the surface and attempt the journey into Imcandoria.

The giants have seen omens of death in the forges and have suggested we go with reinforcements. They've given us a bright fiery jewel that we can use to bargain with the Auspah tribes around Imcandoria.
The city is empty, there are sounds coming from the temple. We approach with caution.
Piles of bodies. Pools of blood. A large globulous mass sat hungrily on a throne of oily black rock, a shock of tentacles capped with claws dangled above its three pulsing bulbous eyes.
The Elders circled the creature, chanting incantations in a strange unknown tongue, covered head to toe in a mixture of blood and thick black sludge.
[The elders] paid us no attention until the creature noticed our presence and began screaming. A fight soon broke out and the temple quickly turned into a blaze, the flames licking the ceiling.

The harsh cackle from the elders as they burned, pierced our minds with unimaginable terror. We're none the wiser of how that... thing... came to be, but that idol must have been far older than we first assumed.
I, Highseer Gulbrand of the Isle of Garmr, have assembled various entries detailing the fall of Imcandoria.
These texts are inscribed in rock paper in a tome even I struggle to lift.
I leave this tome in the entrance hall of our great Necropolis. Heed my warning reader and do not travel into that frozen wasteland. All that awaits is death.
It seems [the Imcando] have been promised a new home here in return for wiping us out.

If... If what you say is true, how does it relate to Lord Iorwerth's claims? (...)
[Player: Lord Iorwerth spoke the truth. [Seren] created a fragment of herself, filled with darkness, hoping to use it to break the curse. It didn't work though, so she sealed it in the Temple of Light.

Am I? My whole life, I've been fighting Lord Iorwerth. My whole life, I've believed him to be a servant of Zamorak. Now I learn that everything I fought for was a lie. [...] I don't even know what I'm leading any more...
We [aviantese] were here to claim something. To protect it. But everything else is unclear.
Big High War God use the shiny to kill the chickens! Now we clear up the rest!
Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but I think this 'shiny' might have killed you as well.
I saw [Nomad] build [the Soul Obelisk] with me own eyes. I were the one who 'ad to carry his materials to this island!
My messenger pigeons help me communicate with friends over the wall.
My father's friend Jerico is in communication with West Ardougne.
I have arranged for two friends to aid you with a rope ladder. Omart is waiting for you at the south end of the wall.

Later, Guthix noticed that the rocks continued to weep, and that their tears were infused with a small part of His power. So He set me, his servant, to guard the cave, and He entrusted me the task of judging who was and was not worthy to access the tears.
According to legend, the justiciars were the elite of Saradomin's forces. Some worked alone, operating as assassins behind enemy lines. Others led entire armies in Saradomin's name.
Strange, when I saw him last he had no magical hand to speak of...
The Justiciar of the Lion is a title bestowed upon the most powerful wizard of our order. She was capable of wiping out an entire army of Zamorakian demons with a single spell!
...he has given us the task of protecting it [the Stone].
You must build a sanctuary for the Eye. The forces of chaos already seek to reobtain it, as do countless others.
Last I heard, she was residing in the college here in Hallowvale.
[Who's this Justiciar of the Owl?] Saradomin's wisest of servants. It surprises me that you've not heard of his many feats.
These plants were grown personally by Zachariah, the Justiciar of the Owl. Anything he plants blossoms with unimaginable vigour. You may have noticed that he has a love for lilies.
...he has given us the task of protecting it [the Stone].
Zamorak has tasked his collector with finding the Eye. I will hunt him down before he does, along with any others who would try to claim it.
Strange, when I saw him last he had no magical hand to speak of...
No, but I do recommend you pick up Kaleef's dagger. I can assure you, it packs some punch.
No, I hardly knew him. He was meant to tell me how to get out of Menaphos; now that he's dead, I'm stuck here.
I'd say so; It managed to pierce that bug's shell.
Indeed. I'm glad he took on board some of my teaching.
[Player: Who are the Rantuki tribe?] A proud and noble tribe of Karamja. But now we are few, as men come from across sea, steal our land, and settle on our hunting grounds.
Well, this one time I found this spooky old temple in the middle of the jungle.
I'd found a huge cave with all these platforms. I reckon it be an ancient civilisation that made it. I had to be mighty careful as there was these traps everywhere! Dangerous it was!
[Player: That's a nice boat! Would be a shame if something were to happen to it.] Made from the wood of the Fyburglars tree, strong and light weight! Perhaps if it went missing, I'd find you.
This is truly incredible bwana... So these are the remains of the dread Queen Rashiliyia?
It should be clear to anyone that I am the chief of Tai Bwo Wannai. I ensure that things run smoothly in this village.
I don't think so Bwana, but you may want to consult with Trufitus the Shaman in Tai Bwo Wannai village, he may have some information which could help.

My people are afraid to stay in the village. They have returned to the jungle. I need to commune with the gods to see what fate befalls us. (â¦) Most excellent Bwana! You have returned all the herbs to me and, I can finish the preparations for the potion, and at last divine with the gods.

Be wary Bwana. There are many unknown spirits that reside in these dark areas. You may be tricked by an unknown forceâ¦ [Player: What kind of unknown force?] Strange spirits that our forefathers summoned for visions. They haunt the underworld and caves that exist in this area.
I need to make a special brew! A potion that helps me to commune with the gods. For this potion, I need very special herbs, that are only found in the deep jungle.
I dare not touch it. I am a spiritual man and the spirit of this being may possess me and turn me into a minion of Rashiliyia.
The 'Vacu' were priests who summoned the spirits of our ancestors. But the priests were enslaved by the evil spirits of the underworld.
Zadimus is a spirit yearning for freedom. Bury him in a sacred place to release his spirit. (â¦) The ground in the centre of the village is very sacred to us. Maybe you could try there?
I vow upon the blood of my fallen kin that I shall not set foot in that godforsaken village till I have slain the Shaikahan.
The deaths of my kin have been avenged. You are my witness.
All of my people normally congregate around a totem pole. But ours has been polluted by an evil spirit. It has been transformed, and now our people are afraid to approach it.
I've heard strange rumours about something the locals call the Broodoo.
The jungle is very ancient and many unspeakable acts have been witnessed on these lands.
So far three distinct Broodoo have been identified.
notes: Sentences like these illustrate how "Broodoo" is synecdochically employed to refer to the creature rather than the practice.

quote: I think they may be sacrifice victims â but I'm not sure why they are sacrificed.
These strange creatures have the curse of the Broodoo on them! They'll rise from their grave with their heads in their chests and move like crazy spirits of the afterlife.
Bizarre supernatural curses were placed on criminals and then they were buried alive!
I haven't quite worked out what they are but they seem to be some sort of undead whose ghastly fate depends on the way they were killed.
However... it is said that the means of their death provides the clue to their destruction.
The Broodoo with a green hued skin is said to have died from poison.
There is a broodoo of yellow hue and a pale skinned broodoo, but little is known of these two!
My people are afraid to stay in the village. They have returned to the jungle. I need to commune with the gods to see what fate befalls us.
There were some strange occurrences in Tai Bwo Wannai. The people fled their village because their gods were angry with them, or the like, but now they have returned.
I have communed with my gods and the future looks good for my people. We are happy now that the gods are not angry with us.
He claimed that he had seen the enemy abducting various beasts from the caves north of Karville.
Demons, giants and spectres were just some of the ones he mentioned.

Camorra came from the town of Saranthium and sat next to the one with a crossbow. The one from Zartharim sat at the north of the table, opposite the one with the sword. The one with an axe asked the one to their right what the journey from Karville was like. Suddenly, Aivas stood up, surprising the one from Arkney on his left. Tristan was showing off his sword when the bow wielder next to him called for silence.
Of course, the kin are not strangers when it comes to experimenting on creatures, but the scale here is much larger than anything they've done in the past.
Our purpose was to wait. But we saw the world burn. We could not stand by and watch. So we left our people. Left our home. And took on a new purpose.
Alas, according to records, the party never returned and were declared to have perished in the field.
Without the power of the Dark Altar, Xeric would have become mortal.

This [unstable] altar, it seems to give off the same power as the Dark Altar... I believe this altar was created to amplify the power of the Dark Altar, allowing it to reach areas it previously couldn't.
Sadly, the kingdom of Great Kourend is besieged by lizard creatures and it is not possible to get out of the kingdom just yet.
...we've pushed the lizardmen back to the point where we're finally able to allow citizens such as yourself into the region.
Not too long ago you couldn't safely travel around these parts. Too many lizardmen. But then some Hosidius explorers discovered how fertile this land was.
Lord Hosidius made a deal with Lord Shayzien and the lizardmen were cleared out to make room for the Farming Guild.
If [the lizardmen invade], we can quickly call in reinforcements if required.
Luckily the lizardmen have been focusing their efforts elsewhere. They haven't tried to come up here yet.
We set [a human bank] up here to help your kind serve the balance with us.

Did you know that Keldagrim was originally constructed by a long lost clan who embraced the power of magic, and used it to aid with glorious buildings like the royal palace? They even stayed down there for 1000 years or more, in a time they call 'The age of Kings'.
name: postie

quote: We dwarves went underground a long time ago, see. For a while the city of Keldagrim was completely cut off from the rest of Gielinor simply waiting out the wars of the humans and the gods.

Librarian: You'll find books dating from many different eras as well, such as the Era of Kings, the Rise of the Consortium and the Era of Prosperity, our current era. Player: How do these eras correspond with the Ages of the world? Librarian: Oh, they are quite different, and most of them take place in the Fourth Age. Since dwarves hid underground for a long time to sit out the wars that rages above the ground our history books differ slightly from those written by humans
name: hugi

quote: In the Era of Kings, many centuries ago, it was harder of course. Our steam technology was not developed as far yet and getting fresh supplies of food was always a problem.
Only when King Alvis heroically defended the city against an invasion of trolls did we dare to venture out and see how much the world had changed.
Yes, there was a time, back in the Fourth Age, when we humans wouldn't have been able to venture underground. That was before we had magic; the dwarves were quite a threat.
Oh, no no, we dwarves don't use magic. All of this is powered by steam engines, developed over the past few centuries after the Consortium came to power.
We can grow a little food underground, but most of it comes from the extensive steamcart network that runs beneath the earth.
We dwarves went underground a long time ago, see. For a while the city of Keldagrim was completely cut off from the rest of Gielinor simply waiting out the wars of the humans and the gods.
Only when King Alvis heroically defended the city against an invasion of trolls did we dare to venture out and see how much the world had changed.
That Wise Young Man drove us out into the barren icy mountains. Without Mother's strength to overcome obstacles and catch food, I believe we would have perished.
He kick you out of Keldagrim long back, now My Arm got him dead in gift-box!
That Wise Young Man drove us out into the barren icy mountains. Without Mother's strength to overcome obstacles and catch food, I believe we would have perished.

When the barbarians came, many tried to fight. I should have fought with them, but I turned away. I had a duty to my people, but I abandoned them. The barbarians had blocked all exits, so the only way to flee was down. I hid down here while my people died, but now I pay the price for my choice.
loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire

quote: During the great war, our forces were decimated by the servants of the Ruinous Powers.
At the time of his [Osmumten's] rule, our people were locked in a great war. To hold back the Ruinous Powers, our gods granted us immensely powerful weapons.

To turn the tide, Icthlarin and Amascut sought powerful allies to aid us. They found them far from here, in a place beyond this world. A powerful race of faceless ones. They became Icthlarin's Stern Judges.
The armies of the Ruinous Powers were far stronger than our own. That was until Icthlarin's Stern Judges joined the fray. Thanks to them, the war was seemingly won.
Among the Stern Judges, there was a serpent. After my father [Osmumten] became Pharaoh, this serpent convinced the others to abandon us.
We were powerless against a force of that might. Nothing could stop their advance.
[So how did the war end?] It was Tumeken himself. He sacrificed himself to annihilate the enemy. The cost was great, but the war was won.

My father ruled during the great war. While the war was eventually won, many considered the cost too great. My father led us with the support of the gods, yet he was the one people blamed. [So they killed him?] Him, and the rest of my family.
I would have died as well, were it not for the bravery of my father's servants. They gave their lives, so that I might live.
When the war was over, my father was tasked with hiding those weapons, lest they fall into nefarious hands. Two of them were buried with him.
The weapons in my father's tomb can be used to drain a being of divine energy and transfer that energy to another. If used correctly, they would grant the Devourer true godhood.
Kharyrll was completely destroyed by Zamorakian forces.
We became desperate, so we took one orb of protection to the battlefield. It was a foolish move.
Khazard troops. They slaughtered anyone who got in their way. Women, children, my wife.
They took the other orbs, now we are defenceless.
I have no idea, but it's a great victory for Lord Daquarius. To take such a mighty supporter of the White Knights down... Truly brilliant.
[King Kharedst] married late and his wife... Unfortunately didn't survive bringing Rose into this world.
Apparently Rose and her father would often make riddles for each other. I'm guessing she was quite fond of them.
Are you saying the man I sold those trinkets to was the king?! Those were dark objects, corrupted with powerful magic. Dark magic.
The flask was cursed. Some dark magic. He stopped being himself. Started saying things. Things he would do to people. To the citizens!
There was an Arceuus mage. He was an expert in curses, and he realised what was happening. He gave us the poison for the King.
By then, it was already too late. The King had deteriorated too much. There was only one solution.
Kourend's last King, Kharedst IV, had only one child when he died. She was too young to take the throne, so the Kourend Council was formed to look after things until she came of age.

5th Age - Year 136 King Ulthas of Ardougne dies from an accidental arrow shot while out on a hunting expedition. Ardougne is left to his 2 sons, Tyras and Lathas who decide to split the city between them.
name: divide

quote: One of the survivors of the great battle became king in year 98 of the 5th Age. His goal was to listen to the people's views and ensure a fair and equal life for everyone. He was the first of a line of kings in Ardougne that continues to this day under his great grandson, King Lathas of Ardougne, painted here.

5th Age - Year 132 King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table arrive on RuneScape in the year 132 of the 5th Age. Legend says they will return to Britain in its time of greatest need, so they're passing their time on RuneScape until then. King Ulthas saw them as good and rightful men who would do much good in the world, and granted them a large area of land to set up a new Camelot in north-east Kandarin.

The original aim of the Death Guard was to secure a foothold in the east, in preparation for 'His' arrival. Now though our objective has become a little more...how should I put it...proactive. That fool King think we are here as his ally, we duped him into thinking that Iban was enough of a threat that he let us setup here. Lathas even thinks 'He' will help him dispose of the Knights of Camelot. The plague was actually fabricated by King Lathas', to justify the building of the city wall. But it has also worked in our favour too. We help him keep the people of Ardougne believing in the plague, but now after the discovery we have bigger fish to fry here.
name: hm

quote: One of the things we do is keep the rumours of the plague active is to keep that old farmer Brumty believing his sheep are infected. The old half-wit thinks just because his sheep are an abnormal colour, that they are all ill with plague. It's amazing what a bit of dye can do.
Do you know the outpost north of Ardougne? Well, the King was going to make that into an alchemy lab for us, but some fool ruined our plans!

[It] protects them from a far greater danger, a fear too big to fathom. Their King, Tyras, journeyed out to the West on a voyage of discovery. But he was captured by the Dark Lord. The Dark Lord agreed to spare his life, but only on one condition... that he would drink from the Chalice of Eternity. The chalice corrupted him. He joined forces with the Dark Lord, the embodiment of pure evil, banished all those years ago... And so I erected this wall, not just to protect my people, but to protect all the people of Runescape. Now, with the King of West Ardougne, the Dark Lord has an ally on the inside.
This word-guessing game was invented by Mad King Narras of Ardougne in order to encourage literacy among his subjects.
Today it is played with an effigy rather than a real person
King Rada I, founder of Great Kourend
name: Statue

quote: King Rada I: 10th BA
King Rada II: 9th BA - 7th BA
King Rada II: 9th BA - 7th BA
King Rada III: 7th BA - 6th BA
The Tower was constructed under the rule of King Rada III, though we don't know exactly when
By the command of His Royal Highness King Rada III, here follows the complete census of the skilled peoples, animals and estates of the Lords of the settlement of Kourend.
In the 13th decade, King Shayzien III seized control of Kourend using the military under his command.
King Shayzien III: 13th - 15th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.

The Royal Accord of Twill and all agreements bound within cease to exercise authority in all regards to governance of the Kingdom of Great Kourend. The Right of Succession is no longer observed and all titles held within bare no right of governance.
The Kingdom of Great Kourend is henceforth governed by the newly formed State of Kourend. The State of Kourend exists to serve the Monarchy.

The Monarchy bears sole responsibility for the appointment, dissolution or replacement of the Head of State. The role of Head of State belongs to the Monarchy until such time that statement V may be actioned. Governance of revenues is to be managed by the state. Mobilisation of forces is to be governed by the state. The territory of the Kingdom of Great Kourend and all assets within are property of the state.
Lord Lord Lovakengj III: 12th.

The Royal Accord of Twill no longer plays much part in the rulership of Kourend. It was breached in the 13th decade when King Shayzien III seized control of the kingdom. It hasn't been honoured since.
Indeed. While the Shayzien Army is by far the largest military force in Kourend, the other cities still have some form of militia, apart from Arceuus of course.
notes: Although Captain Bruce states here that Arceuus maintains no militia, this is probably due to having given up their corporeal forms during the Ascent of Arceuus, which presumably would make it difficult for their citizens to engage in physical confrontation. However, their ascension would not take place until much later, during the reign of King Byrne II, making it likely that Arceuus still disposed of some kind of organised militia during King Shayzien III's coup d'Ã©tat.

quote: According to the history books, his reign was defined by violence.
When I was a boy, my grandfather would tell me the story of my ancestor, Magnus Rimor. He was a great explorer that lived over a thousand years ago.

One day, Magnus was approached by none other than King Shayzien VII himself. The King asked him to lead an expedition to explore Mount Quidamortem in the Kebos Lowlands. Alas, according to records, the party never returned and were declared to have perished in the field.
Unfortunately, it was a failure. The entire party was killed.
The King spent a lot of his time at the Tower, more than any other ruler. In fact, he oversaw the construction of various new sections, most notably the prison.
The king was killed at the Battle of the Concourse during the thirty-seventh decade. We have many accounts of this yet his body was never recovered.
Just days after his death, we have the first recorded mention of Xeric, an incredibly powerful mage who resembled the king.

...we know the Dark Altar has the power to resurrect beasts. We also know that it can extend life. It's how the people of Arceuus are immortal. King Shayzien VII may have found a way to combine these powers.

My father, King Ulthas, once ruled over a united Kandarin. I was his eldest son, the kingdom was my birthright! But my fool of a father took that from me. When King Arthur and his knights arrived in our lands, my father granted them the castle of Camelot, ousting the loyal subjects that previously lived there. Not only that, but he also declared that the kingdom be jointly ruled by my brother and I, rather than giving it to me as he should have. When I ascended to my half-throne, I promised myself that I would unite this kingdom again, no matter the cost.
That's why I made the deal with Lord Iorwerth. In return for access to West Ardougne, he agreed to help me kill my brother and drive out King Arthur.

[It] protects them from a far greater danger, a fear too big to fathom. Their King, Tyras, journeyed out to the West on a voyage of discovery. But he was captured by the Dark Lord. The Dark Lord agreed to spare his life, but only on one condition... that he would drink from the Chalice of Eternity. The chalice corrupted him. He joined forces with the Dark Lord, the embodiment of pure evil, banished all those years ago... And so I erected this wall, not just to protect my people, but to protect all the people of Runescape. Now, with the King of West Ardougne, the Dark Lord has an ally on the inside.

[...] when King Arthur and his knights appeared, old Lord Sinclair agreed with King Ulthas that the knights had greater need for the castle than the Sinclair family. So, Lord Sinclair had the mansion built, packed his family up and vacated.
Originally, the Sinclair family lived in Camelot, although it went under a different name then.

My father, King Ulthas, once ruled over a united Kandarin. I was his eldest son, the kingdom was my birthright! But my fool of a father took that from me. When King Arthur and his knights arrived in our lands, my father granted them the castle of Camelot, ousting the loyal subjects that previously lived there. Not only that, but he also declared that the kingdom be jointly ruled by my brother and I, rather than giving it to me as he should have. When I ascended to my half-throne, I promised myself that I would unite this kingdom again, no matter the cost. That's why I made the deal with Lord Iorwerth. In return for access to West Ardougne, he agreed to help me kill my brother and drive out King Arthur.
Well, I should thank you for finding my kitten that time. I have a terrible time keeping track of them, and I never know how many Gertrude has managed to sell.
All right, men, destroy that evil sorceress... and her temple with her!
Besides, I am already wounded, and have been so for many years, thanks to this spell you cast on me. And hungry. So very, very hungry.
Call me Astra! Now, I must see to this discovery as it may indeed help my mission. May the light shine upon you!
Through their foul arts, they [the Calamity Coven] turned this Arena into a hotbed of corruption.
Koriff used her charms to act as a gracious hostess, whipping up the crowds' excitement so that they'd gamble more and more unwisely, enriching the Coven.
I was there when Kharedst the Builder opened Kourend Castle
She [Rose] was too young to take the throne so the Kourend Council was formed to look after things until she came of age.
Alas, she was very close to her father and his sudden death drove her to insanity. With no suitable ruler, the Kourend Council was made permanent.
...After the incident she was locked away.
The accusations aimed at poor little Rose were ridiculous...It was all nonsense, the king died naturally! He was old, he'd been on the throne for at least 40 years.

Oh, there was no particular accident. It's just years of wear and tear. The Lady Lumbridge is an old crandorian fishing ship - the last one of her kind, as far as I know. That kind of ship was always mightily manoeuvrable, but not too tough. She happened to be somewhere else when Crandor was destroyed, and she's had several owners since then.
Wow! You sure are lucky! Seems the Lady Lumbridge just washed right up into the dock by herself!
No, it's not. It may, to the untrained eye, at first appear to be the Lady Lumbridge, but it is definitely not. It's my new ship. It just happens to look slightly similar, is all.
It has Lady Lumbridge painted out and 'Klarense's Cruiser' painted over it!
It was a steal from the Karamjan shipyards. And when I say it was a steal, I mean to say that myself and some of the lads broke in and stole it one night.

I don't know who they were building these warships for, but whoever it was seemed to be a little on the short side. We had to do a little remodelling of the doors and rooms so that we didn't have to crouch around everywhere, but I've finally got her just how I want her, and we have enough cannons down below decks to bombard a small town I'd wager!
I am offering to trade it [the ring of visibility] for an item that was rightfully mine, but that [the gilded cross] was stolen by a bandit named Laheeb.
Oh, thank Armadyl! I am in such a worry... please help me!
Do the shining spires of Lassar still stand?
...another dwarven clan has joined the Saradominists. They march upon the fortress as we speak.
...Inform him that the enemy leader has been identified... Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj.

When the barbarians came, many tried to fight. I should have fought with them, but I turned away. I had a duty to my people, but I abandoned them. The barbarians had blocked all exits, so the only way to flee was down. I hid down here while my people died, but now I pay the price for my choice.
Mysterious Voice 1: What am I looking at here? [Sliske]: An answer. Mysterious Voice 1: To what question? [Sliske]: What lies beyond?

Mysterious Voice 1: Then we'd better not waste time. There are resources that can be diverted, though there will be pushback. [Sliske]: It will be dealt with. My companion will remain to oversee your research. She will ensure that you face no barriers.
[Sliske]: I have shielded it. It will do you no harm.

[Sliske]: Have the undercity sealed, then remove the protections on the totem. We require a more thorough test. [The Whisperer]: And the researchers? [Sliske]: Their work is complete. Do with them as you wish.

Mysterious Voice 2: The undercity is being sealed. They say the fortress has fallen. Mysterious Voice 3: Sealed? On whose orders? Mysterious Voice 2: Well... yours. Mysterious Voice 3: I gave no such order. Round up the centurions! We have a traitor among us. [The Whisperer]: No. Mysterious Voice 3: You! This was your doing! [The Whisperer]: You have served your Empire well, High Magister, but that servitude is at an end. Now it is time for a new one to begin.
Mysterious Voice 1: Do not be afraid, my child, for you are not alone. Your voice will be one of thousands, singing an eternal silence.[...]And so another voice joins the Silent Choir.
I can't live with your rules any more. Mother. I'm tired of working hard for very little money. There's great wealth that's mine for the taking!
No. You see I haven't seen him for... for.... 25 years now.
Sorry, but your mother and I... tried so hard to find you!

Oh I wish I knew for sure.... All I do know is that it opened seemingly by itself few months ago. It was first discovered by the students over at the digsite, a few of which have gone down there, but never returned. They told me about it straight way.
My husband went to look, but he hasn't returned for days.
I was foolish to ignore my parents' warnings when I ran away that day. Luckily I've been able to patch things up with them so they've returned home with peace of mind.
Hugi, my parents named me that, it means "personification of thought" in the ancient dwarvish tongue.
The last descendant of the Gontamue line was Lilith Gontamue. She married into the Fitzharmon family.
K'uhul ajaw isss the name we ssspeak. You manfolk ssspeak a different name.
We make sssacrifice, offeringsss to our massster. Thisss and that. Whatever our massster desssiresss.
Of courssse, sssome of usss remember the high ssspeech out old massster ssspoke in.
Yesss, we ssspeak the language of war far better. It isss the only way we know of.
If you come thisss way again, could you bring more of thossse chilli potatoesss? Our ssstocksss have dwindled lately...
Lord Arceuus I: 5th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Arceuus II: 10th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
at the advice of Ethrain Hosidius, Seabry Shayzien, Ret Piscarilius, Solange Lovakengj and Bourath Arceuus all royal Lords of our kingdom.
I was born into the Piscarilius House as the only child of Lord Dalton Piscarilius. After my fool of a father got himself killed on a fishing trip, leadership fell to me.
name: Death

quote: My father never cared about anyone. He was far more interested in increasing his own wealth at the cost of his people.

Those of us who survived the Edgeville incident and recall what the Black Knights activities under Lord Shadwell were like, can see that Lord Daquarius is better to keep around than risk another fanatical extremist taking his place. For all of his misguided belief in Zamorak, Daquarius is an undeniably noble man; we have numerous reports of him risking personal injury so that he may save a fellow Kinshra from harm or death.
Lord Hosidius I: 1st
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Only yesterday did I meet with the lords of the other houses and we agreed in principle that all houses would offer half their land so we may farm more.

My most venerable Council, I beseech you to grant my request as mentioned in previous meetings at your chamber. We can grow enough food to extricate us from the famine we have experienced these last five years. However, I cannot do so without the appropriate amount of land.
The Royal Accord of Twill was signed by the rulers of each of the houses 139 decades ago, following the great famine.
Lord Lovakengj I: 2nd
Lord Hosidius II: 6th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Hosidius III: 11th
