...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.

That fool King think we are here as his ally, we duped him into thinking that Iban was enough of a threat that he let us setup here. Lathas even thinks 'He' will help him dispose of the Knights of Camelot.
name: foolking

quote: The plague was actually fabricated by King Lathas', to justify the building of the city wall. But it has also worked in our favour too. We help him keep the people of Ardougne believing in the plague, but now after the discovery we have bigger fish to fry here.

Not long after we convinced Lathas that it was a good idea to let us run West Ardougne, we found evidence that somewhere under the mountains to the west there is a place of ancient power. We have been using those we take from the city to help us dig down to it. Unfortunately we have opened up a few old caverns infested with beasts.
Lord Lovakengj I: 2nd
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Lovakengj II: 7th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Lord Lovakengj III: 12th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
In the 13th decade, King Shayzien III seized control of Kourend using the military under his command.
Lord Piscarilius I: 4th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Piscarilius II: 9th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
at the advice of Ethrain Hosidius, Seabry Shayzien, Ret Piscarilius, Solange Lovakengj and Bourath Arceuus all royal Lords of our kingdom.
at the advice of Ethrain Hosidius, Seabry Shayzien, Ret Piscarilius, Solange Lovakengj and Bourath Arceuus all royal Lords of our kingdom.

The charismatic Lord Daquarius was the youngest Black Knight to ever take lead of the Kinshra, being unanimously voted into leadership after the death of Lord Shadwell in the infamous incident at Edgeville.

Those of us who survived the Edgeville incident and recall what the Black Knights activities under Lord Shadwell were like, can see that Lord Daquarius is better to keep around than risk another fanatical extremist taking his place.
Lord Shayzien I: 3rd
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Lord Shayzien II: 8th
...the date convention in Great Kourend is to state the number of days and decades since the signing of the Royal Accord of Twill.
Old Lord Sinclair was a well respected man this side of White Wolf. He was great friends with King Ulthas and did many good works for the kingdom.

His children on the other hand were spoiled and horrid. They cared for no one but themselves and gave themselves such aires. [...] His children were furious with him for doing it. They felt themselves far better than the knights and felt insulted at having to live in a stuffy mansion.

[...] when King Arthur and his knights appeared, old Lord Sinclair agreed with King Ulthas that the knights had greater need for the castle than the Sinclair family. So, Lord Sinclair had the mansion built, packed his family up and vacated.

[The Sinclairs] used to live in the big castle, but old Lord Sinclair gave it up so that those strange knights could live there instead. So the king built him a new house to the north. It's more cramped than his old place, but he seemed to like it. His children were furious at him for doing it though!
Originally, the Sinclair family lived in Camelot, although it went under a different name then.

It never sat well with the Sinclair children when their old man gave the castle to king Arthur and moved the family to this mansion. I suspect the murder of old Sinclair was just the first step in a deeper plot to retake their 'birthright'.

[...] the guards received evidence from one of the family members that conclusively proved Anna did it. All other evidence was thrown out, it was that good. So they arrested her and soon the case will go to court.
Anna Sinclair, you are hereby declared 'not guilty' by a jury of your peers. You are free to go.
The Sinclairs have wanted to get their slimy hands on Camelot since their father's death.
at the advice of Ethrain Hosidius, Seabry Shayzien, Ret Piscarilius, Solange Lovakengj and Bourath Arceuus all royal Lords of our kingdom.
Losanium is the official term for this religion, though it is not a term you'll find used very often.
Whereas in other parts of the world you'll likely find followers of many gods, here in Varlamore, you'll only really find those dedicated to Ralos and Ranul.

Long before leaving Kourend, the Talkasti had taken to secretly worshipping Ralos and Ranul. After arriving here, they were able to openly practice their religion for the first time. Over time, the Pericans started to adopt this religion as well.
Metzli and her sect play an essential role in our lives. You should not judge her so harshly.
Its (the world) light will one day die, (...) But even in ash, embers remain. From those embers, a new world will be born, and the cycle will continue once more. This is Ximoua.
This knowledge is a gift. One that was passed down to us from the Old Ones.
(...) we will all meet Ranul in the end. (...) it is he that will guide us. He will lead us through the Gates of Mictl to where we may finally rest.
It's an unofficial religious belief concerning the end of the world. Oddly enough, our friends in the Twilight Emissaries are big fans of it.

Indeed, and that is why this is just one interpretation. There are those out there with another: Tsak Tauli, the Final Dawn. (...) They do not just believe that the world will end. They believe it is their duty to make it happen. They see it as their singular purpose, and will stop at nothing to make it so.
You have been gone too long, brother. While you spend your days hidden away, lamenting about that stupid rock, our kind suffer.

I rememeber when I was young. Our father would take me out into the woods, hunting. That was where I truly discovered what it meant to be alive. The constant fear. That knowledge that if you fail, your very life may well be over. But then at the same time, the thrill. The thrill of the chase. Of the conquest. Nothing can match it.

One day, he decided to bring my sister along. He felt it was time for her to develop her own taste for the hunt. She was a natural. A raw talent I had never seen before, and rarely since. I felt a unique pride that day.

Back on our homeworld, new clan leaders were selected during a festival known as the Night of the Blood Moon. It was a simple concept. A full night of killing. At dawn, the one with the most kills became the new leader. Lowerniel loved it. He won every time of course.
You and your kind, you have spent your years engrossing yourself in culture, in aristocracy. Pretending to be something you're not.

During the war, they managed to capture a justiciar, one of Efaritay's most elite warriors. They tortured him for days, until he gave them what they needed. [Player: Which was?] A secret tunnel, leading directly into Efaritay's castle. The tunnel was here, in this very graveyard. Once they were inside, capturing Ascertes was easy.
Efaritay surrendered that same day. She walked into Lowerniel's camp, alone, and willingly handed herself in. I guess she had hoped that Lowerniel would free your father in exchange for her.

Safalaan Hallow: What happened then? After you had your way with him, what became of my father? Vanescula Drakan: He still lives to this day, under a different name of course. Safalaan Hallow: What name? Tell me! Vanescula Drakan: Vanstrom Klause.
Verzik ended up getting Efaritay's castle. It was quite the boon for her.
Alas, all that ended when the vampyres invaded, claiming the land as their own. Morytania wasn't enough for them though. Soon, they set their sights on these lands as well.
Before they were defeated, the Seven Priestly Warriors managed to bless the Salve with the holy power of Saradomin.
The temple here was built soon after. It guards the source of the River Salve, and acts as the only passage between Misthalin and Morytania.
Ah yes, the great 'Count' Draynor. He loved his stupid titles. He was weak even before he got trapped on the wrong side of the Salve. A coward as well. There's a reason Lowerniel had him banished.
The emanations from the rest of Morytania affect the people here terribly turning them into mindless creatures.
The people are affected by the emanations from the rest of Morytania and the dead from the tombs have manifested into shadow creatures.
For our kind to be less reliant on humans would be a fundamental change to our society. History has told us that leaders generally don't survive such a transition.
It seems that the bark of the Blisterwood tree can be used to create weapons that are deadly to my kind.

You have been gone too long, brother. While you spend your days hidden away, lamenting about that stupid rock, our kind suffer. Out there, in your city, they're starving. There's not enough blood to go around and their great leader is unwilling to provide a solution.

Every day that goes by, the number of humans in Morytania decreases. Yet while this happens, our population continues to grow. Unsurprisingly, we no longer have enough blood to go around.[...][W]hile all of this happens, our great leader remains absent.[...]Under my rule, I would see us return to that way of life.
[E]ven today there are many in Darkmeyer who still blindly believe in Lowerniel. It will be much easier for me to take his place if I am not responsible for his demise.

You will pose as my prisoners and I shall escort you to Castle Drakan. Your capture is something that even Lowerniel will be unable to ignore. [Player: And once inside, we kill him.] Exactly. A nice and simple plan.
Tell me, Vanescula. What is the cause of this latest betrayal? How is it I have displeased you this time?

[W]hen you play your games of politics, you do not do so because you're smarter than me. When you weave your words and make your schemes, you are not getting the better of me. No. You do these things only because I allow it. Because your plots are so insignificant to me, that I do not even care to pay attention to them. But now Vanescula, now you have my attention. And now, you will be reminded what it means to cross the lord of Vampyrium.
Out of all the people of Crandor there were only three survivors: a trio of wizards who used magic to escape. Their names were Thalzar, Lozar and Melzar.
Unfortunately, goblin raiders killed her and stole everything. One of the goblins from the Goblin Village probably has the map piece now.

We rob house of stupid wizard. She very old, not put up much fight at all. Hahaha! [Player: Uh... Hahaha.] Her house full of pictures of a city on island and old pictures of people. Me not recognise island. Me find map piece. Me not know what it is, but it in locked box so me figure it important.
A few weeks ago, I'd have told you to speak to Lozar herself, in her house across the river from Lumbridge.
The last descendant of the Raispher line was a lady named Lucinda Raispher. She married into the Fitzharmon family.
Can't the human take a hint? I've been ignoring you! Do you think I would ignore you if I wanted to discuss your Rorschach ink-blots?
That you've been doodling? If you don't mind, I have a job to do. Please stop distracting me.
For why you show-a me dat? Eez very nice to see yous learning to draw! Bravo!
They look familiar, but I can't think where I've seen marks like that. Try asking around, maybe somebody else will recognise them.
Sorry dearie, no, but I have seen a sign with similar marks near the mysterious ruins. You know, the ones that lead you to the Cosmic Altar.
She showed me some symbols, she then asked me to draw five of them throughout the ship. Some kind of magic jinx.
I was lured by a girl from the Moon Clan, she promised me control of the ship if I did this simple task for her. I couldn't resist.
None of yer bis'ness.
She is our mother, our creator, we owe everything to her.
While her initial creations held some intellect, the latest ones have been purely instinctual.
He wants me to join him, but I won't leave her behind. She is our mother, our creator, we owe everything to her.
She cries out for him, desperate for him to return to her. [...] In her desperation for him to return, she has created new life in his image. They are pale imitations though, shadows of him and I.
Their creation has been sapping her energy, and I fear she will grow too weak. All may not be lost though, for I may be able to convince them to sacrifice their energy and return it to her.
I am left with no choice, for I am powerless to help her. I have to leave her, before it is too late.
In her desperation for him to return, she has created new life in his image. They are pale imitations though, shadows of him and I.

All may not be lost though, for I may be able to convince them to sacrifice their energy and return it to her. [...] The beings that sacrificed themselves for her slowed things down, but it hasn't been enough.
No, I hardly knew him. He was meant to tell me how to get out of Menaphos; now that he's dead, I'm stuck here.

After you have been alive for as long as I, the things I know are enough to fill a library. [...] As you may or may not know, myself and my blood kin are the rulers of this land, all serving under Lord Drakan.
A human, eh? (if you are wearing the Ring of Charos (a)) Don't think that silly little ring of yours will fool me.

The spiteful Saradomin and pathetic Zamorak warred with each other, but the hatred they had for each other was as nothing to the hatred they held towards us! With each battle they waged, we lost more and more land, unable to fight on all fronts, and were pushed further and further South into this gods-forsaken desert. Our greatest hero, Azzanadra, was finally trapped in a strange stone structure to the South of here, and bound within by terrible powers...

Thus (guarded/protected) by the (unusually archaic word here, I believe it means either the sick or the dead depending on the context) and (defended/trapped) by the (diamonds/crystals) of (this word is untranslatable). [...] (Guarded/Protected) by the (again, this word has no modern equivalent) and held by the (worthy/strong) so that the (wealth/power) might forever be (imprisoned/concealed).
They were stolen by warriors of the false god Zamorak generations ago.
Beware too, for these warriors are very powerful; they have taken the powers of the diamonds into themselves!
Mort'ton is just a dead town, full of afflicted and Lord Malak was so ill when he drank of them last time.
Through their foul arts, they [the Calamity Coven] turned this Arena into a hotbed of corruption.
Maoma was a captain of the Emir's guard, but she abused her authority to rig fights so that the Coven would get rich at the people's expense.
Well, Marimbo is the only goddess for me and you won't persuade me otherwise.
I imagine [Martin] also didn't mention that he used to work for the Council that he hates so much.
I'm sure Lydia didn't tell you everything about herself either. We were together once, you know. But she was ever loyal to the Council. In the end she decided I wasn't her type.
When I worked for the Council, I was young and naive. But over time, I came to see the truth.
I was helping to manage the treasury at the time. We had a big donation come in from a private businessman.
He wanted the money to go towards improved education in Port Piscarilius. He felt it would help with the crime levels there.
...they used only a small amount for that. They spent the rest on castle renovations.
They claimed the increase in castle tourism would make more money in the long run.
I walked out that same day. Soon after, I founded Kourend's Royal Society. We've been a bane for the Council ever since.
Would you believe it that apparently [Sophia Hughes] went and summoned a demon in Port Piscarilius? That made a lot of people angry.
Martin. He's leader of Kourend's Royal Society. He knows more about the last royal family than anyone. If anyone can help you find Rose, it's him.
Martin Holt, I am arresting you for inciting violence against the Kourend Council. [...] You have encouraged people to take up arms against the rightful rulers of Kourend.
They took [Martin] to the Shayzien Prison, just west of the city.
Can you believe it? The coronation of a king! Truth be told, there were times I wondered if this day would ever come.[...] And to think they even let us vote on [Rose's Accord] as well! Fantastic!
When the people voted on Rose's Accord, they voted for the Hosidius family to become the new royal family.
My job is to advise King Artur and ensure his actions have a positive impact on the people that he now rules.
Census of King Rada III, by Matthias Vorseth.
notes: Item examine text.

quote: By the command of His Royal Highness King Rada III, here follows the complete census of the skilled peoples, animals and estates of the Lords of the settlement of Kourend.
There was a time when Burgher Burowgar was similar to King Sorvott. Argumentative, short tempered...
The change happened when trolls came and razed Neitiznot to the ground.
The Burgher lost his wife and youngest son in the trolls' raid and has been a changed man since.

My father ruled during the great war. While the war was eventually won, many considered the cost too great. My father led us with the support of the gods, yet he was the one people blamed. [So they killed him?] Him, and the rest of my family.
I would have died as well, were it not for the bravery of my father's servants. They gave their lives, so that I might live.
I found solace here with a group dedicated to Scabaras. In time, I became their leader, and the Sect of Scabaras was formed.

Good job. As we don't have the troops available to take on his forces directly, I suggest we try some alternative tactics. I have this book here which details an explosive reaction. We should be able to use it to create a bomb.

Our two kingdoms were at war with one another for centuries. They tried to expand their kingdom northwards many times over the years, but we held them off. The desert is a great equalizer [sic]. It's very difficult to move large armies about in it, particularly if you don't have ready access to water.
The fighting in the desert has come to a stop. However, there is still much distrust between Menaphos and Al Kharid. It seems like it would be possible to reignite the war if needed.
I've had my people instigate a bit of civil unrest. Officially our cities may be at peace, but I have some old scores to settle first.

We are the chosen, exiled from Menaphos for trying to overthrow the Pharaoh. Loyal servants of Amascut the Devourer, God of Destruction. We are regrouping to launch another offensive against the thrall of Tumeken, using Pollnivneach as a spawning ground for revolution!

Well, it all started the day that the plagues broke out here. I had gone into Menaphos in the morning to get some flour and chocolate powder and, when it came time for me to return, the gates were shut.
Well, word must have travelled back to the slaves that their fellow slaves in Sophanem no longer had to work and so they rioted.

It was, but Coenus, chief gate keeper of the city, stamped the revolt down fairly fast... and quite brutally. [...] No, it was only stopped in the imperial and merchant quarters of the city. There is still trouble in the slums and in parts of the docks.
Imafore's death was over a hundred years ago! His family had no love for him then, and they've loyally served the Arkans since.
However, we are now ruled by the Arkan dynasty, whose name can be traced back to early Talkasti nomads.

King Mezpah Arkan. One of his first acts was to call for the beheading of every statue of Imafore in the kingdom. The statues remain to this day. It's actually a crime to try and remove them. They exist as a reminder of our history, and a warning to any who would try to follow in Imafore's footsteps.
I am the great niece of King Vallance himself.
Stepmother? Ho! Good lord, no. No king in his right mind would marry a hag like that! No, this is her evilâsecond-cousin, twice-removed.
The oldest tortoise ever recorded was Mibbiwocket
Tortoises generally live as long as people, and some individual ones are known to have lived longer than 300 years
notes: (As Mibbiwocket is the oldest tortoise ever, he necessarily has to be included in that statement).

quote: Mibbiwocket is still in the care of the gnomish royal family.
[Mibbiwocket]... was presented to the King Healthorg the Great, by the famous explorer Admiral Bake, shortly after its birth.
I have a story to tell you that will answer most of your questions. Let us travel back in time, to the time you humans call the Fourth Age.
notes: Cutscene shows King Healthorg mounted on Mibbiwocket.

quote: What is the name of the oldest tortoise ever recorded?
Well, much of the day-to-day running is handled by the Colosseum Master, but yes, I am the one overall in charge of this place.
This is more than just a place of spectacle. You stand in one of the holiest sites in all of Varlamore.
Morytania wasn't enough for them though. Soon, they set their sights on these lands as well.
The warriors were the ones to bless the River Salve and build this temple, ensuring that Misthalin would be forever safe from the evils of Morytania.
name: Drezel

quote: Sadly, all seven of them fell in the final battle against Drakan. They are now buried here, in this very mausoleum

one warrior priest, so bent on the destruction of evil, made countless charges deep into Morytania. His name was Ivandis and we believe that he perished within the lands now spoilt by Lowerniel Draken [sic].
The temple here was built soon after. It guards the source of the River Salve, and acts as the only passage between Misthalin and Morytania.
Mort Myre was once a beautiful forest by the name of Humblethorn until the evil denizens of Morytania descended.
Dutiful servants of Saradomin... At least, that's what they'd tell you! Ha! Not so. Not so.
Long ago, the land of Morytania was known as Hallowvale and it was ruled over by a race of Saradominists called the icyene.
They guard it for him! That was their purpose

Well, this isn't the first time the Temple Knights have encountered the Mother Mallum. Centuries ago we discovered that a great evil had taken control of some of the most influential people in the world. That great evil was the Mother Mallum.

It took the few remaining uncorrupted knights all their wit and strength to devise a method of removing sea slug possession. Once freed, the Temple Knights pursued a great crusade to destroy the Mother Mallum. Unfortunately she was too powerful and the best they could do was to trap her inside a mystical prison.

It all began a few weeks ago. We pulled up a haul of deep sea flatfish. Mixed in with them we found those slug things, but thought nothing of it. Not long after that my friends began to change. Now they spend all day pulling in hauls of fish, only to throw back the fish and keep those nasty sea slugs.
The Pescallion has declared that until we have finished our research of the southern species and have developed our great plan, we may not return.
No, our people live in the great city of Palingrad, of course.

list: I miss the fresh codfish of our motherland.

quote: I see you have some raw cod with you, comrade. I might be willing to exchange information for it, if you are willing. [Sure!] Thank you comrade. This is like a taste of the motherland.

Enakhra: It didn't have to be that way, Hazeel. We had proxies available. Had you supported my plan, we'd have the Horn by now. Hazeel: Unlikely. Your minion failed to recover even one of the medallions.
loc: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire

quote: A mysterious old man turned up today. Not sure how he got in. Kept pestering us until eventually Davey spoke to him, at which point he offloaded a load of spinach rolls onto us then left.
That mysterious old man has turned up again. We don't have time for this, quite frankly, so we're just going to ignore him, after all what could be possibl...
Quickly they [the Sect] established this guild with information preservation as their core goal, for men are recorders of history and magic is key for this to last.

As time passes, that which was once fact, becomes myth. Some tales are just that, tales. However, some tales are something more. Here at the Myths' Guild, we live to tell the difference between the two. If you wish to join us, you must do the same.

The story my father told me was of a war on magic, god fearing men who believed nothing good would come of wielding a power that was never meant for them. And so the rune temples that man had created were under threat, all were destroyed and thus forgotten, but the wrath that these Gunnites embraced rippled through the pocket dimensions and a new altar of power was discovered.
...the Sect of Uhld had used the information gained from the wrath altar, and with a spell of their own making, they destroyed the southern runecrafting crusade with much ease.

For centuries, the magic used to seal the Moons has been woven into Neypotzli and the creatures that inhabit it. Naguanil is the magic of nature. A ritual involving the living parts of this place could re-infuse the icosahedron.
Nardarine came from a town towards the north side of the desert which does not exist today.

Her town was once controlled by Saradomin, but there was a great battle there between Saradominist and Zamorakian forces which pretty much levelled the town to the ground. Most of the human citizens perished. Nardarine had the wisdom to escape into the desert before the fighting got really serious and thus survived.
However she found herself wandering lost and alone in the desert.
She prayed to Saradomin for help, but Saradomin was too concerned with the loss of a strategic outpost to worry about the fate of one small human.
Nardarine had wandered towards the realm of the Menaphite God Pantheon. Elidinis heard the prayers of Nardarine, she took pity on the wandering human and came unto her with water.

Elidinis replied 'I will grant this unto thee on the condition that thou swearest to forever pay fealty and homage to me and I grant this also unto thine descendents as long as they too will pay an oath of fealty and homage to me'. Nardarine said 'If you would grant me a safe home, with a supply of food and water, then I would surely do this for it is more than any other God would seem to do for me'.

Then Elidinis made a spring of water appear at Nardarines feet and brought stone from below the sand so that she might have something to build with. She called forth camels which have many uses and taste good in kebabs. She then provided Nardarine with a statuette in her image to worship. Nardarine built up her home.

Over time more refugees from the god wars found Nardarine's home. Nardarine let them stay with her as long as they did make the same oath as her. Hence the town of Nardah was born and Nardarine lived the rest of her days in the peacefulness that she craved.
The obscure magical art of necromancy has nothing to do with Summoning.
Yes, I believe [a priest] would be the closest comparison to the Church of Saradomin, though I am no expert in their practices.
"For those of us dedicated to Ranul, our primary duty is to care for the dead and prepare them for the journey through the Gates of Mictl.
For those of us dedicated to Ranul, our primary duty is to care for the dead and prepare them for the journey through the Gates of Mictl.
Although their god was gone, many Zarosians fought to keep his empire alive.

She [Nex] was Zaros' most powerful weapon, and she led a great army to try and restore his empire. Not that she needed an army of course. Nex alone was powerful enough to hold back hundreds of lesser beings.
The forces of Saradomin knew that Nex needed to be dealt with. They were able to lure her into these caverns.
After great effort and sacrifice, they managed to place Nex and her followers into a frozen, enchanted sleep.
Once Nex was no longer an immediate threat, they built the Temple of Lost Ancients around her. Most of the temple has since fallen to ruin, but you can still see some of the remains.
Later in the war, a great battle broke out in the Temple of Lost Ancients. I was a Saradominist soldier at the time, and I was among those who fought for him in that battle.
...many of us had grown tired of war. One of our priests discovered this. He came to us and revealed that he felt the same way, and that he had secretly converted to Guthix.
He encouraged us to join him. We abandoned the cause of Saradomin and became followers of Guthix.
Our new leader taught us the ways of the druids, including an ancient ritual that had the power to awaken Guthix himself. We believed this ritual to be the only way to end the war.
When our leader led us to perform the ritual, it was not Guthix we woke, but Nex and her forces. The ritual also destroyed the protective enchantments on their prison.
I never saw him [the priest] again. He never gave us his true name, but as Nex was freed, she spoke to him... I heard little of what they said, but I did hear what she called him. Sliske.
Nex posed such a danger, that the four armies temorarily joined forces to drive her back into the prison. They resealed it, but were unable to fix the enchantments we destroyed.
How very kind of you. But Nickolaus Farrick never needs rescuing.
name: rescue

quote: Stepmother? Ho! Good lord, no. No king in his right mind would marry a hag like that! No, this is her evilâsecond-cousin, twice-removed.
You're right with that one [laddie/lass]. Someone or something has made a small hole in the Doors.
It's not much, but it's enough for that Wintertodt to be able to draw some power into the prison. Probably why them fiery lot have had so much trouble recently.

[Player: Does this mean the Wintertodt won't be a threat anymore?] That should be the case in the long run. I suspect it will take a long time though. The Doors were damaged for a while and the Wintertodt will have gained a lot of power. I reckon that magic lot will have to do their fiery tricks for a bit longer before everything is back to normal.
I've no idea, it must have been Oaknock's, he liked talking to the elves.
Drezel is the priest who lives at Paterdomus, the temple to the east.
those Zamorakians attacked this place and imprisoned me up here.
This coffin here contains one of those vampyres. The Zamorakians somehow found it and brought it here with them.
I fear this group of Zamorakians intends to take advantage of that. If they can somehow pollute the Salve, the blessings on the river might fail.
If that happens, there won't be anything to stop an invasion from Morytania.
This knowledge is a gift. One that was passed down to us from the Old Ones.
It [soul tranference] was their final attempt to overcome their extinction, but they failed. What you see around you is the result of their failure. It's known as the Strangler.
It's some sort of parasite. It was presumably meant to play a role in their transference rituals, but instead it destroyed them. It has remained here ever since.
"This mural has an inscription beneath it, written in the language of the Old Ones. I think I'm getting there, but I'm going to need more time to decipher it."

I followed one called Lazim. He let slip that he had discovered the buried temple. Now the two others who were there are on the move. The General may find there are new players at the ritual this time.
Tell them: The planets are nearing alignment; we will meet in the place of half light and ice soon. Beware of the others, for though they are weak and few, they are cunning.
Yeah, it were made of stone, and it were odd. Some weird bone-head human saw me trying to nibble it, an' he got really upset an' chased me away. He kinda scary.
Anyway, my parents, they named me Odd Stone after that, and now we trolls not go anywhere near the place. Bone-head human was, like, really scary! And probably magic.
No, we trolls blocked all routes to snowfields from here. Don't want scary bone-head human coming to Weiss.

The ritual is used by our kind to ensure our survival, and the next one is fast approaching. [...] For the rest of us to live, one of us must die. Many will go to great lengths to ensure they are not the one who is sacrificed.

Our rejuvenation ritual takes place right above us. There have been times in the past when the weaker of our number have tried to hide themselves nearby. [Player: Why?] To claim power from the ritual without the risk of being chosen as the sacrifice.

Now a deal's a deal, I'll tell ye about the treasure. I used to serve under a pirate captain called One-Eyed Hector. Hector were very successful and became very rich. But about a year ago we were boarded by the Customs and Excise Agents. Hector were killed along with many of the crew, I were one of the few to escape and I escaped with this.
name: Frank

quote: This be Hector's key. I believe it opens his chest on his old room in the Blue Moon Inn in Varrock. With any luck his treasure will be in there.
Need I remind you that it was the Zamorakians who burnt down the first Wizards' Tower?

Observation suggests that the Z.M.I. is the same faction of Zamorakians that burnt down the Wizards' Tower in Operation: Phoenix, but firm conclusions as to the reason for this remain at best sketchy and unsupported by evidence.
name: Commorb

quote: For years, the tower was a hub of magical research. Wizards of all races and religions were welcomed into our order.
The wizards who served Zamorak, the evil god of chaos, tried to claim our magical discoveries in his name. They failed, but in retaliation, they burnt the entire tower to the ground.
When the tower burnt down, much was lost, including an important incantation. A spell that could be used to teleport to a hidden essence mine.
A Zamorakian wizard made a great breakthrough in teleportation magic, but the Saradominists stole his research.
They used it to perform a ritual, but their lack of understanding caused it to go wrong. The entire Wizards' Tower burnt down. Many were killed, and years of research was destroyed.
This basement is all that is left of the old tower.
Did you know that the Order of Wizards wasn't always a Saradominist group? Once they allowed mages of all faiths to study with them.
After the tower was rebuilt, we were banished from the Order of Wizards and forced underground.

The rediscovery of runecrafting had such a large impact on the world, that it marked the dawn of the Fifth Age. It also resulted in the birth of our order, and the construction of the first Wizards' Tower.
For years, the tower was a hub of magical research. Wizards of all races and religions were welcomed into our order.
They banned Zamorakian wizards from certain areas of study, claiming them to be too dangerous. In reality, they [Saradominists] just wanted that knowledge for themselves.
When the tower burnt down, much was lost, including an important incantation. A spell that could be used to teleport to a hidden essence mine.
This basement is all that is left of the old tower, and I believe there are still some secrets to discover here.
The wizards who served Zamorak, the evil god of chaos, tried to claim our magical discoveries in his name. They failed, but in retaliation, they burnt the entire tower to the ground.
Naturally, they blamed the Zamorakians. Claimed we intentionally burnt the tower down. After the tower was rebuilt, we were banished from the Order of Wizards and forced underground.
They used it to perform a ritual, but their lack of understanding caused it to go wrong. The entire Wizards' Tower burnt down. Many were killed, and years of research was destroyed.
A Zamorakian wizard made a great breakthrough in teleportation magic, but the Saradominists stole his research.
Our order searches tirelessly for a way to defeat the Wintertodt. Until we discover it, the Wintertodt must be held at bay.
Ever since the Wintertodt was imprisoned, the Order of the Sacred Flame has stood vigil over this place.
I am Ignisia, Grand Master of the Order of the Sacred Flame. I have served our Order faithfully since I passed the Trials of Fire before the Ascent of Arceuus.
It's not much, but it's enough for that Wintertodt to be able to draw some power into the prison. Probably why them fiery lot have had so much trouble recently.
The doors were damaged for a while and the Wintertodt will have gained a lot of power.
Even though the doors are fixed now, it will take many years before things get back to normal.

Player: A Pyromancer? Xamphur is working with a Pyromancer? 
Player: Hang on... I recently helped to repair some damage to the Doors of Dinh. What if this Pyromancer was the one responsible? 
Kaal-Mej-San: Impossible to say. 
Kaal-Ket-Jor: But a coincidence is unlikely.
You said it was red, right? [...] Must be orikalkum. Dragon as you adventuring lot call it. Quite rare.
I'm perfectly happy here in Al Kharid. I've done all the adventuring I ever wanted to do in my youth.
Oh, he used to come here all the time. Then one day, he just stopped.

npc: The man who is not Osman
quote: Osman and the Sorceress had a falling out. Now she won't give any of us spies fruit from her garden.
I've been in Sophanem more times than I'd care for and, besides, I'm not a spymaster for nothing.
I'm sure to be recognised; we'd then have to fight our way through the town. Any hopes that we had for the truce between our cultures would then be as dead as the guards.

Technically, yes, but that doesn't mean that bad blood will instantly run good. As spymaster of Al Kharid, I've been responsible for many a dark deed. The Menaphites would find it difficult not to try to punish me or extract certain delicate information out of me if I managed to fall into their arms.

We discovered a stash of them in some of our investigations. As far as we have been able to determine, it was created by worshippers of Elidinis in order to smite the followers of Scabaras. They are specially enchanted against both scarab creatures and kalphites...which is odd, since we thought the two races to be entirely different.
Well done. A great rescue. I will remember you if I have anything dangerous to do.
I've had my people instigate a bit of civil unrest. Officially our cities may be at peace, but I have some old scores to settle first.
She's in Menaphos and that city is locked tight to everyone, thanks in no small part to me.

Kaleef 
Your mission is to contact our agent inside Menaphos. Use the tunnels beneath the temple of lesser gods. Be vigilant of traps and the hostile natives. They're about as welcoming as the Menaphites only slightly better looking. 
Os
He was meant to tell me how to get out of Menaphos; now that he's dead, I'm stuck here.
I got some cream from a merchant in Al Kharid that was meant to help but all it seems to do is repel insects.
It's good to see he went out fighting. [...] Indeed, I'm glad he took on board some of my teaching.

They are a symbol of the wise. You see, owls can see the light in the darkest of places. [...] These creatures have the blessing of Saradomin and the wisdom of ages long past. They are the watchers of the Hallowed Sepulchre. The last defence against unseen evils.
No, our people live in the great city of Palingrad, of course.
The Pescallion has declared that until we have finished our research of the southern species and have developed our great plan, we may not return. So I am stuck here observing humans.
The next group were the Pericans. They first settled right here, building the town of Fortis, or Civitas illa Fortis as it eventually became.
The name comes from the River Varla that separated Talkasti and Perican territory.
For example, here in Fortis, you'll find yourself surrounded by Perican archetecture, whereas over in the Tlati Rainforest, the influence of the Talkasti remains clear.
For most of our history, we were ruled by the Tullus dynasty, with Tullus very much being a name of Perican origin.

It's [a tablet] written by one of the crew on Perseriya's ship. Apparently they snuck into her private cabin... And found Imperium inside! This was after Imperium had already been delivered to the east!
The one she took east was a fake. She secretly kept the real one. The intention must always have been to hide it here.

It was indeed me who sent that parcel. Had I revealed the contents of the journal myself, I would likely have just been dismissed as trying to create a rift between our two houses. Phileas was the perfect third party.
They're operating there under the name of the VTAM Corporation. Be careful. The Phoenixes ain't the types to be messed about.
Shortly after the fight some gang members decided they didn't want to be part of our gang anymore. So they split off to form their own gang. The Black Arm Gang.
the shield got broken in half during that fight.
On their way out they looted what treasures they could from us - which included one of the halves of the shield.
They're operating there under the name of the VTAM Corporation. Be careful. The Phoenixes ain't the types to be messed about.
Hey! You can't go in there. Only authorised personnel of the VTAM Corporation are allowed beyond this point.
Ah, the white wolf we called her... For she had the brightest hair you'd ever seen. A silver so bright it could blind. Some said she had icyene blood, but those close to her knew better.
I serve the fierce Justiciar of the Wolf! The most loyal and fiercest of Saradomin's followers! We are the bastion against all that is evil.
The white wolf was but a mere human, albeit with astounding prowess on the battlefield... She vied for Saradomin's attention the most out of all the justiciars.
Phosani embraced the glory of Zamorak and most of our order did the same. After that, she became known as the Inquisitor, though our order refers to her as 'Mother'.
This [sanctuary] was sealed, only to be reopened once Mother had awoken from her deep sleep.
This nightmarish creature that the siren warned us of has made a home here. That was reason enough for her to unseal the entrance.
If you want to go further afield, why not have a look at the ominous Pillars of Zanash, the mysterious marble pillars located just West of the city?
That particular shrine has existed since before Witchaven was even founded.
The shrine was abandoned when the village came into being. Since then it has fallen into disrepair and the other less savoury elements have moved in.
The history of that shrine should not be overlooked. It is ancient beyond your knowledge and much that shaped our history is contained within its walls.
We rarely come this far to the west, the climate is too cold for our tastes.
Back home on the other hand, our numbers equal the humans. Sirens live on pretty much every island in the archipelago.
[The book of haricanto] was stolen when our port was raided by pirates many years ago, and never seen since.
My brother had exactly the same problem.
Has anyone ever told you that you are a useless troll? My grandmother has more guts than you and she doesn't even have her teeth anymore!
Though you dress in the colours of evil, you will not follow that path. You will remain true to Guthix.
Interesting, I've always liked eight myself.
Well... I know things about myself. I know I like hot chocolate!
's a sulphur mine. Ye get sulphur here. For making the dynamite, ye know? Folks use it in the blast mine. Watch the poison gas clouds, though - they'll choke ye.

From what I can tell, he is completely mad. He roams the Wilderness, killing all who he comes across without mercy. Even his own kind do not escape his fury. He's known to battle the justiciar quite regularly, perhaps they are old enemies.
I graduated over 200 human years ago. Look, there's my Advanced Healing Certificate on the wall.
One of the security measures put in place during the God Wars, from the outside it seems like there's nothing there.

...Another being came to our world. Divine like myself, but not by design. He spoke of a perfect world, one filled with power. I knew it was a risk, but I decided to travel there. The power he spoke of might have been the only thing capable of saving the elves. The curse made it impossible for me to go without them, so they had to come with me, and leave their home behind.
This here is the Gauntlet, the finest creation of the Amlodd clan. It was built years ago to help train Prifddinas' finest warriors and survivalists.
At the end of the God Wars, the gods were banished from this world. Seren didn't want to leave us though, she couldn't.
The song of creation increased their [the elves'] lifespans, but at a terrible price. It bound them to me. To stray too far from their sides, caused pain, and even death.
She [Seren] shattered herself into thousands of crystals. Those crystals are all we have left of her now.
Baxtorian and the other clan elders made one final ditch attempt to save Prifddinas. They sung the song of inversion to revert the entire city to a crystal seed.

Their [the clan elders'] plan worked, and the city was lost to Lord Iorwerth. However, it was lost to the rest of us as well, the Grand Library with it... With Prifddinas gone, Lord Iorwerth has claimed the land where it once was. He's managed to manipulate the defences to only allow his allies to enter.
After Prifddinas was reverted to seed, the clan elders went into hiding. Before we parted ways, the others did leave me with some clues on how to find them.

It [the Dark Lord] was just a ruse I'm afraid. A lie we told King Lathas to get him on our side. We needed access to West Ardougne so we needed the support of the king. Once we found out about his hidden worship of Zamorak, it seemed like an obvious lie to tell... You're right to say that the temple is key to summoning a god, but that god is not Zamorak, it's Seren.
...I managed to break one of the seals within the Grand Library. That's how I discovered the truth. A part of Seren lives on, trapped within the Temple of Light.

A part of me, trapped and alone. Dark, yes, but still a part of my being, sealed away in the Temple of Light. The protections of the temple, they should keep her contained. But in case they don't, I created one last safeguard, a prison within a prison. With it I made a key, an orb of light, to unlock the darkness. The shrine at Gorlah, that is where it lies.

I thought he'd [Lord Iorwerth] turned his back on Seren, thought he'd betrayed her. But I was wrong. Everything we thought we were fighting for was a lie. He never betrayed her, everything he did was to free her.
I served Lord Iorwerth because I didn't have a choice. The other elves realised that, hence the pardon.
The others still hold a lot of mistrust for our clan. It will take a long time for those rifts to be repaired. We are on the right path though.

There's no place for me here anymore, not after what I've done... I wanted to stay long enough to help repair the damage of my actions, and to look upon Prifddinas for the first time... There's a lot of places on this world that I've never seen. Maybe one of them will help me find redemption, and forgiveness.

Speaking of which, myself on the other elders have come to an agreement. For too long, we've been afraid of outsiders, showing them mistrust while our own kind plot against us. After all that's happened, we've decided that from now on, that will no longer be the case. We will open our city up to the other races, letting them walk among us for the first time.
While we've opened up the city to other races, we've decided that most of the library will remain a place for elves only.
Now that the city is open to visitors, we've had lots of new additions from far and wide.
Rabid Jack! THE Rabid Jack! Egad... I haven't heard that name... before.

One of the pirates on the island said [Jack's name] while in the grip of a terrible fever. The others quietened him down and refused to answer any questions about it. I have no doubt they know who it is, but I get the feeling that they will not tell you.
After we take the island I'll have the boss haul yer body to the temple and... Err, never mind.
*Wheeze* I have received a summons to attend to the Captain and so will be 'down below' for a while.
Yes, one of the brothers observed him and a few of his sorebones slipping into the water shortly after there was a loud bang from inside the building.

*Wheeze* Excellent... the gas will leave the brain intact for the next stage. *Wheeze* This time there will be no rebellion amongst the subjects. *Wheeze* Rabid Jack will have his crew of enhanced zombies and I will have as many test subjects as I can vivisect! *Wheeze* Hekhekhekhek!
Besides, Rabid Jack would have my hide if I told ye it were him that sent me!
You see, I was set to marry Asleif, the most beautiful woman ever to grace this world.

I was going to give her a necklace, when we were supposed to meet here many years ago. I still have it, and since it was a gift for Asleif, technically it's hers. Take it, outerlander, and bury it with her. It will be my parting gift.
name: necklace

quote: But but but... He's not a god! He's a man in a bearsuit! And he killed your daughter! And why didn't you tell me she's been missing for more than ten years?
Fourteen years, to be exact. And I didn't say otherwise, did I?
note: Quest takes place in 169 Fifth Age

quote: My father does not believe that I am dead. In his heart, he knows it to be true, but he cannot accept it.
Do not say such things, outlander! She is not dead, merely missing. She will show up again... yes, yes, I'm sure of it.
Sometimes I think I can hear her singing, but when I follow the sound around the pool I just end up here again.
I do not want to see any of the corpses you're carrying around with you! Begone!
I heard the news from Hamal, outerlander. Alas, I have known this had to be so for a long time, but Hamal just didn't want to listen.
I am a travelling monk from the distant land of Varlamore... I worship Ralos, a common practice where I am from.
The sun plays an important role in Varlamorian life. In fact, they worship it!

This is more than just a place of spectacle. You stand in one of the holiest sites in all of Varlamore. Each drop of blood spilt here is a glorious offering to Ralos. It is these offerings that sustain him. Without them, he will not have the strength to light our way.

Losanium encompasses the worship of both Ralos and Ranul, and while they do indeed go hand in hand, it is rare to find individuals equally dedicated to both.
Instead, most people focus their worship on one of the two, with Ralos being by far the more popular. Something that isn't too surprising given Ranul's association with death.
He's managed to keep the city going all these years, even with his lack of vision.
My lack of vision means I can't work an anvil like I used to.

I came to cleanse these mountain passes of the dark forces that dwell here. I knew my journey would be treacherous, so I deposited Spheres of Light in some of the tunnels. These spheres are a beacon of safety for all who come. The spheres were created by Saradominist mages.

I remember seeing one such warrior. Going by the name of Randas... ..he stood tall and proud like an Elven King... ...That same pride made him vulnerable to Zamorak's calls. Randas' worthy desire to be a great and mighty warrior also made him corruptible to Zamorak's promises of glory. ..Zamorak showed him a way to achieve his goals by appealing to that most base and dark nature ...that resides in all of us.
Randas was another great man, but he let himself be beguiled into turning to serve Zamorak, and they say he is now a mindless creature deep in the Underground Pass that leads to Isafdar.

It began as a whisper in my ears. Dismissing the sounds as the whistling of the wind I steeled myself against these forces, and continued on my way. But the whispers became moans... At once fearsome and enticing like the call of some beautiful siren. Join us! Our greatness lies within you, but only Zamorak can unlock your potential...

Losanium encompasses the worship of both Ralos and Ranul, and while they do indeed go hand in hand, it is rare to find individuals equally dedicated to both.
Instead, most people focus their worship on one of the two, with Ralos being by far the more popular. Something that isn't too surprising given Ranul's association with death.
(...) we will all meet Ranul in the end. (...) it is he that will guide us. He will lead us through the Gates of Mictl to where we may finally rest.
For those of us dedicated to Ranul, our primary duty is to care for the dead and prepare them for the journey through the Gates of Mictl.
Something that is easily forgotten is that while Ranul is indeed a god of death, he is also a god of learning and knowledge.
Following the rebellion of the five houses against King Rada III, the Council of Elders was formed. They used the Tower as a meeting place for the Council.
Saradomin is popular with many uneducated citizens of Kourend, but you may use our church to worship any god you prefer.
You sound like the Saradominist peasants from Hosidius, always assuming they must serve one god above all others.
The Tower was constructed by King Rada III. We don't know exactly when, since dates were not recorded before the Twill Accord.
The Royal Guard was established by King Byrne I. He felt that it was dangerous for Shayzien House to control the only military in the kingdom, so he decided to establish a small one of his own.
I work for a business known as Sandy Sand Co.

Being so close to the shore, Rellekka provides a lot of seaweed alongside my sand... the seaweed from Rellekka, in combination with my sand business, provides a huge amount of glass for the surrounding areas! Fellow Fremenniks aren't too pleased with my outside dealings, though know how important my job is. I think they let it slide for that reason.
The last descendant of the Prysin line was a lady named Rhee Prysin. She married into the Fitzharmon family.
We haul all our goods to the city by ship, you see.
Molten snow, you see.
But this water here, you see, it comes dripping down from above.
No fish around here.
The name comes from the River Varla that separated Talkasti and Perican territory.
Reality as you know it has many layers, all slightly different with their own rules. Through the power granted to me, I brought us to this layer using the River-Between. The River of Souls.
name: Sage

quote: [Well what are you interested in stealing?] The heart of a lovely raccoon called Rodney.
[King Kharedst] married late and his wife... Unfortunately didn't survive bringing Rose into this world.
Apparently Rose and her father would often make riddles for each other. I'm guessing she was quite fond of them.
Are you saying the man I sold those trinkets to was the king?! Those were dark objects, corrupted with powerful magic. Dark magic.
The flask was cursed. Some dark magic. He stopped being himself. Started saying things. Things he would do to people. To the citizens!
There was an Arceuus mage. He was an expert in curses, and he realised what was happening. He gave us the poison for the King.
By then, it was already too late. The King had deteriorated too much. There was only one solution.
Kourend's last King, Kharedst IV, had only one child when he died. She was too young to take the throne, so the Kourend Council was formed to look after things until she came of age.
We didn't want to kill her. She didn't deserve that. The mage gave us a potion. He said it would stop her revealing the truth.
I did some research while you were gone. [Councillor Orson] wasn't lying. The poison they gave [Rose] irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure.
Alas, she was very close to her father and his sudden death drove her to insanity.
After what happened, public life was no place for her. The Council arranged for her to move away so she could escape all of that.
With no suitable ruler, the Kourend Council was made permanent.

The poison they gave her irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure. Someone else could make the potions, but all they do is prolong her suffering. This is no life for anyone. The truth is, Rose died long ago. All that's left now is an empty shell.
In honour of her sacrifice, I name this declaration Rose's Accord. With it, the Kingdom of Great Kourend will no longer be a kingdom divided.
When the people voted on Rose's Accord, they voted for the Hosidius family to become the new royal family.
Unlike the Shayzien Army, the Royal Guard serve the ruler of the kingdom directly.
The Kourend Royal Guard protect and serve the ruler of Kourend. As their leader, I am responsible for ensuring that the Royal Guard are well trained and well supplied.
The Royal Guard was established by King Byrne I. He felt that it was dangerous for Shayzien House to control the only military in the kingdom, so he decided to establish a small one of his own.
The Royal Accord of Twill was signed by the rulers of each of the houses 139 decades ago, following the great famine.
Following the rebellion of the five houses against King Rada III, the Council of Elders was formed. They used the Tower as a meeting place for the Council.
note: While it is not stated explicitly who initially joined this council, on the basis of the Eathram & rada extract, it could be expected to have included the lords united under Eathram, that are mentioned by name in the narration.

quote: The Accord declared that each house will, in turn, rule the Kingdom of Great Kourend for one decade in rotation, based on lots drawn.
The Forge powers the entire city, or what's left of it at least.
We've lost all contact with the capital. Worse, another dwarven clan has joined the Saradominists. They march upon the fortress as we speak.
Rumour has it [the Imcando] once lived in a great city in the far north. The city fell and now they are homeless.
It seems [the Imcando] have been promised a new home here in return for wiping us out.
Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj. He has fled to the west with his closest allies, but much of his army still remains.
Our methods would often differ from other dwarves. Whereas they just used traditional smithing techniques, we would combine them with magic as well.
We used our advanced Smithing knowledge to improve their form. Eventually, we were able to get them working again. We kept pushing with the golems. Many of them we imbued with magical energies.
Camdozaal was built upon the ruins of an older civilization. Little trace of them remained by the time we arrived. However, when building the city, ancient golems were discovered.

We learned of a horde of barbarians pillaging across the land, hunting down and killing anyone who dared use magic. We underestimated them. We believed our weapons would be enough to keep us safe. We were wrong. The barbarians brought ruin upon Camdozaal.
Most of my kind died as the city collapsed around them. Only a few of us survived until the end. Now, only I remain.
The council sent me to check your pipes.
Disturbing message from the council today, they feel that I am not fulfilling my contact to keep my contract to keep the lighthouse operative correcty.
It is slightly unfair that due to his absence the council have forced me to take up his job here at the lighthouse, but what can I say to argue against them?
When asked to find a BOWL that has not seen heat, a large number of adventurers assume that a POT will suffice. Of course, this has no effect, so they send complaints about you to the Council.

I am forced to repeat the warning I gave you at the time: if you continue to indulge yourself in this manner, the Council will have no choice but to transfer you to Entrana where you can be supervised more carefully.
You could buy one [hat] off another player, or wait until they're next made available by the Council.

Ever since the Council allowed those farmers to set up their stalls here, we've had a constant flow of thieves and murderers through our fair village, and I decided that someone HAD to stand up and keep an eye on the situation.
Yeah, the Council's had [Varrock] redecorated.
Just lately the Council wants to let people skip the Tutorial, so - ha ha ha - they dump the job on Skippy. Bah!

A Zamorakian wizard made a great breakthrough in teleportation magic, but the Saradominists stole his research. They used it to perform a ritual, but their lack of understanding caused it to go wrong. The entire Wizards' Tower burnt down. Many were killed, and years of research was destroyed.
V was different. Stories tell of how he unlocked the potential of magic with the single touch of a stone.
The Fremennik were actually the first to discover how to make runes.
[But V--- earned the right to use magic?] Exactly. Now the Moon Clan on the other hand, did not earn that right. Their use of magic is an insult to our people.
Most Fremennik felt we were stealing power from the gods. They could not see past that to the great things we could do with such power, so we split from them and became the Moon Clan
[The Moon Clan] are an evil people, equally cursed and blessed by the magic in their blood.
He and his followers built altars all over Gielinor - which you use today to create runes
[V earned the right to use magic]. Now the Moon Clan on the other hand, did not earn that right. Their use of magic is an insult to our people.

name: Hunding
quote: However, our ways have changed little in the last century. Although more and more people use magical powers, we do not believe it is wise to take upon oneself the power of the gods in this way. To this day, we fight with the mighty sword, the vicious axe and the swift arrow on the wind.

The rediscovery of runecrafting had such a large impact on the world, that it marked the dawn of the Fifth Age. It also resulted in the birth of our order, and the construction of the first Wizards' Tower.

The Fremennik had grown strong in body, while our clan had grown strong in mind. They overpowered our tribe and we retreated to Lunar Isle, where we have lived ever since. The Fremennik then swept over Gielinor destroying the altars we had made, in an attempt to remove all trace of magic from the land.
The Fremennik were not as thorough as they thought. They destroyed only the entrances to the altars, for the altars themselves were on a different plane

And so the rune temples that man had created were under threat, all were destroyed and thus forgotten, but the wrath that these Gunnites embraced rippled through the pocket dimensions and a new altar of power was discovered.
The temple was destroyed just as construction had finished, and a nearby nomadic group called the Sect of Uhld were not pleased with the brutality they witnessed.
Quickly they [the Sect of Uhld] established this guild with information preservation as their core goal.
...the Sect of Uhld had used the information gained from the wrath altar, and with a spell of their own making, they destroyed the southern runecrafting crusade with much ease.
Our methods would often differ from other dwarves. Whereas they just used traditional smithing techniques, we would combine them with magic as well.
We underestimated them. We believed our weapons would be enough to keep us safe. We were wrong.
Only a few of us survived until the end. Now, only I remain.

Some of our young, wishing to try so-called 'civilisation' and the softness of city life, abandon the tribe and move to the cities. It is sad to see them go, but we do not prevent them; we live here in our village because we love this life - we do not force it on those whom it does not suit.
V was different. Stories tell of how he unlocked the potential of magic with the single touch of a stone.
The Fremennik were actually the first to discover how to make runes.
...there was disagreement within the tribe about the implications of making such powerful objects [runes].
They could not see past that to the great things we could do with such power, so we split from them and became the Moon Clan.
[But he earned the right to use magic?] Exactly. Now the Moon Clan on the other hand, did not earn that right. Their use of magic is an insult to our people.
Our ancient leader, who first discovered the rune essence mine here on Lunar Isle, travelled far and wide searching for more places of power.
He [V---] and his followers built altars all over Gielinor - which you use today to create runes.

But the strife between the Moon Clan and the Fremennik heightened. The Fremennik had grown strong in body, while our clan had grown stong in mind. They overpowered our tribe and we retreated to Lunar Isle, where we had lived ever since.
Legend has it that this [runecrafting] was once a common art, but the secrets of how to do it were lost until just under two hundred years ago.
The rediscovery of runecrafting had such a large impact on the world, that it marked the dawn of the Fifth Age.
The Fremennik then swept over Gielinor destroying the altars we had made, in an attempt to remove all trace of magic from the land.
The Fremennik were not as thorough as they thought. They destroyed only the entrances to the altars, for the altars themselves were on a different plane.

And so the rune temples that man had created were under threat, all were destroyed and thus forgotten, but the wrath that these Gunnites embraced rippled through the pocket dimensions and a new altar of power was discovered.
The temple was destroyed just as construction had finished, and a nearby nomadic group called the Sect of Uhld were not pleased with the brutality they witnessed.
Quickly they [the Sect of Uhld] established this guild with information preservation as their core goal.
...the Sect of Uhld had used the information gained from the wrath altar, and with a spell of their own making, they destroyed the southern runecrafting crusade with much ease.
The entire Wizards' Tower burnt down. Many were killed, and years of research was destroyed.
When the tower burnt down, much was lost, including an important incantation. A spell that could be used to teleport to a hidden essence mine.
The Forge powers the entire city, or what's left of it at least.
[The Sacred Forge is] far older than I am. It was supposedly built in the earliest days of the city.
What I do know is that it's been imbued with powerful magic - some said that of the gods themselves.
Through their foul arts, they [the Calamity Coven] turned this Arena into a hotbed of corruption.
Saika was the brains behind their operation, forging the Arena's accounts so that the Coven could keep all the profits, starving the Emir's public works of all funding.
Sand! Lots o' sand! Me boss be Sandy o' Sandy's Sand Corp based in Brimhaven on the isle of Karamja an' I hauls sand fr' there to yon sand pit.
name: Bert

quote: 9am-6pm
Oh my! This is most definitely Clarence, my most able student!
name: Zarvistic

quote: [Why doesn't Bert remember the change in his hours?] Because.... because.... I bribed a wizard to put a spell on him so he would believe everything I say!!
[Why is Bert's rota different from the original?] Because... I changed it.
So that I could make him work longer without paying him more!
[What happened to the wizard?] I...I... I KILLED HIM! So I wouldn't have to pay him and no one would know. I put his body in the next load of sand.
name: Confession

quote: You are standing on the holy island of Entrana. It was here that Saradomin first stepped upon Gielinor.

notes: In reference to the Empty Lord, aka Zaros.
quote: Let us just say that he was a fearsome deity, whose strength was greater than all the gods we knew of on this realm at the time.

To my eternal shame, I decided that I would assist Zamorak and his henchmen in their battle, by secretly casting a spell of concealment upon the staff so that [...] they might use it secretly against their master.

A Zamorakian wizard made a great breakthrough in teleportation magic, but the Saradominists stole his research. [...] They used it to perform a ritual, but their lack of understanding caused it to go wrong. The entire Wizards' Tower burnt down. Many were killed, and years of research was destroyed.
Camorra came from the town of Saranthium

Indeed, there is some relationship between the Kalphite Queen and the desert god Scabaras, but no one is really sure what. During the early part of the fourth age, Scabaras proclaimed himself omnipotent and outlawed worship of all other gods save him. When the people eventually revolted against his repressive rule and banished Scabaras, it is said his blood washed over the scarabs and transformed them into the kalphites we know today. Of course, any right-minded scientist discounts these myths as mere stories, with no historical basis in fact.

We discovered a stash of them in some of our investigations. As far as we have been able to determine, it was created by worshippers of Elidinis in order to smite the followers of Scabaras. They are specially enchanted against both scarab creatures and kalphites...which is odd, since we thought the two races to be entirely different.
name: os

quote: Not really; there are simply details of Scabaras' fall from grace that are only known to we priests. Some of his supposed faults can be forgiven. I just can't explain why at the moment.

Yes, the followers of Scabaras used to be great architects of the subterranean. According to legend, they once planned to build a passage under the river Elid. No doubt Elidinis smote them because none of the followers were ever seen again.
Hah! Those insane earth burrowers! They got their comeuppance! They thought they could undermine the mighty Elidinis so she buried them. They have never been seen around here since.
He's been with our family for twenty years... that's 140 in dog years!
Yes, it seems that centuries ago we discovered that a great evil had taken control of some of the most influential people in the world.
Once freed, the Temple Knights pursued a great crusade to destroy the Mother Mallum. Unfortunately she was too powerful and the best they could do was to trap her inside a mystical prison.
They managed to trap the Mother Mallum behind a mystical prison where she was to wait for all time.
No, I hit a brick wall after that. We had a dragon crash land on our headquarters a few years ago and the resulting fire destroyed a lot of our records.
Dratted thing stole all of our trade.

It all began a few weeks ago. We pulled up a haul of deep sea flatfish. Mixed in with them we found those slug things, but thought nothing of it. Not long after that my friends began to change. Now they spend all day pulling in hauls of fish, only to throw back the fish and keep those nasty sea slugs.
That should delay her plans somewhat. If she follows the same pattern as last time, the important figures of Gielinor will be her next targets.
I think we are going to have to increase our surveillance somewhat.
Calm yourself, my child. We anticipated this eventuality. Go now and prepare the throne for our arrival.
Icthlarin is the god of the dead. He is the son of Tumeken and Elidinis, and brother to the Devourer.
My ancestors lived far to the North of here, and our lands stretched from the sea in the East to the river Lum, and the mountain of ice. From coast to coast, North to South, our domain was absolute.

You are standing on the holy island of Entrana. It was here that Saradomin first stepped upon Gielinor. In homage to Saradomin's first arrival, we have built a great church, and devoted the island to those who wish peace for the world.
notes: Only during the Heroes' Quest
Kree'arra is Armadyl's general during the God Wars, therefor Armadyl must have arrived in the 2nd age; before the God Wars.

quote: The Book of Light and Day says that Tumeken once fell into a deep sleep and dreamt for four days and four nights. The first night he slept and dreamt a good dream. He dreamt of a journey long and arduous. From the loins of his subconscious Apmeken was born into reality; a physical manifestation of his dream. Tumeken continued to have pleasant dreams for a further two days and two nights. After each, a new deity came into being. On the fourth night, however, Tumeken dreamt a bad dream. He dreamt of himself and he dreamt of his increasing isolation caused by his extended sleep. This isolation sprung forth into the world and took the form of Scabaras.
The original building was excavated by the Varrock Museum a while ago. It dated back to the Second Age!
It started during the rule of my grandmother. An ever-expanding empire to the north set their sights on our lands. War soon broke out.
You clearly know little of Icthlarin and his past. Are you aware of the Mahjarrat? They once served Icthlarin, before they left him for Zamorak.
notes: They leave for Zaros, but Zaros is betrayed by Zamorak and some Mahjarrat.

quote: They found them far from here, in a place beyond this world. A powerful race of faceless ones. They became Icthlarin's Stern Judges.
notes: 'They' refers to Icthlarin and Amascut.

quote: The armies of the Ruinous Powers were far stronger than our own. That was until Icthlarin's Stern Judges joined the fray. Thanks to them, the war was seemingly won.
Upon her return, Amascut vanished. She played no further part in the war. Only when the fighting was over did she reappear, but it wasn't really her at all.
It seems highly likely
notes: This is his anwser to the question: So you think it had something to do with the Stern Judges?

quote: Among the Stern Judges, there was a serpent. After my father [Osmumten] became Pharaoh, this serpent convinced the others to abandon us.
We were powerless against a force of that might. Nothing could stop their advance.
[So how did the war end?] It was Tumeken himself. He sacrificed himself to annihilate the enemy. The cost was great, but the war was won.
...but inside I located a great treasure... It was the godstaff of Armadyl. >> I chose that day to take it so that my Lord Saradomin's power...
So I coshed this fella round the back of his head with me bag of jewels, picked up his package and was on me merry way afore he comes to.
notes: Rennard robs Valdez of the staff, without knowing what it is.

quote: Well anyway, when given the task of selling a weapon forged by the very gods themselves, I naturally thought of Zamorak as a potential buyer.
note: Rennard tries to find a buyer for the to him generic weapon

quote: Myself and the rest of Zamoraks honour guard were formulating stratagems in our battle-tent, when that sneaky messenger Kharrim came in offering to sell us the god-staff of Armadyl!

So anyway, Lord Zamorak and his most trusted compatriots, namely myself, Hazeel, Drakan, Thammaron and Zemouregal made plans to overthrow our lord using the god-weapon, and by pledging allegiance to Zamorak as our master, were each to be given a large piece of land as our own in return.
Zamorak stood over the Empty Lord who was slowly... fading from existence... And as he faded, it seemed as though... It almost seemed as though Zamorak became more real
notes: The decisive moment was when the Staff of Armadyl pierced both Zamorak and Zaros.

quote: The Sect of Uhld, the founders of this here guild.
I am Erdan, a descendant of Uhld.
...a nearby nomadic group called the Sect of Uhld were not pleased with the brutality they witnessed.

The story my father told me was of a war on magic, god fearing men who believed nothing good would come of wielding a power that was never meant for them. And so the rune temples that man had created were under threat, all were destroyed and thus forgotten, but the wrath that these Gunnites embraced rippled through the pocket dimensions and a new altar of power was discovered.
...the Sect of Uhld had used the information gained from the wrath altar, and with a spell of their own making, they destroyed the southern runecrafting crusade with much ease.
Quickly they [the Sect] established this guild with information preservation as their core goal, for men are recorders of history and magic is key for this to last.

As time passes, that which was once fact, becomes myth. Some tales are just that, tales. However, some tales are something more. Here at the Myths' Guild, we live to tell the difference between the two. If you wish to join us, you must do the same.
Forgive me, my child, but I have little time to talk. There is always plenty of Ranul's work to be done here in the Colosseum.
For those of us dedicated to Ranul, our primary duty is to care for the dead and prepare them for the journey through the Gates of Mictl.
She [Mah] is our mother, our creator, we owe everything to her.

I have tried to convince him [Zaros] to stay, but he will not listen. He believes our mother is controlling us, keeping us close against our will. He does not see that she only acts out of fear, fear that she might lose us. He wants me to join him, but I won't leave her behind.
She cries out for him, desperate for him to return to her. I've been trying my best to comfort her, but it has been little help.
In her desperation for him to return, she has created new life in his image. They [the Mahjarrat] are pale imitations though, shadows of him and I.
Their creation has been sapping her energy, and I fear she will grow too weak. All may not be lost though, for I may be able to convince them to sacrifice their energy and return it to her.

As she dreams, more beings are manifested. While her initial creations held some intellect, the latest ones have been purely instinctual. She is clearly running out of energy and running out of time. The beings that sacrificed themselves for her slowed things down, but it hasn't been enough.
I am left with no choice, for I am powerless to help her. I have to leave her, before it is too late.
I travelled far and wide, finding nothing but empty worlds, long since abandoned. I almost gave up, but just as I was ready to stop, I came upon a world full of life.

When I first encountered the elves on their homeworld of Tarddiad, it was like I had finally found my purpose. I quickly fell in love with them, and they with me. I set out to help them, to guide them.

As I spent time with the elves, I watched as they withered and died. Each death was a blade through my heart, but none more so than Ceidwad, my closest companion. It didn't seem fair, didn't seem right. They deserved more.
...I found a way to share my essence with the elves, a piece of my being for each one of them. With this gift, their years would number in the thousands, time enough to live the lives they deserved.
In keeping with elven tradition, the gift was given through a song. They called it the song of creation, for it was the creation of a new life for them.

...With all my knowledge, I should have known not to meddle. That which I intended as a gift, soon turned out to be their curse. The song of creation increased their lifespans, but at a terrible price. It bound them to me. To stray too far from their sides, caused pain, and even death.
